Tafseer: Or do they desire to outmanoeuvre? you and have you killed at the Assembly Council. But those who disbelieve they are the outmanoeuvred ones! the vanquished and the ones destroyed. God preserved him from them and then destroyed them at Badr.

Name: The Mount
Verse: Or have they any god beside Allah ? Glorified be Allah from all that they ascribe as partner (unto Him)!
Tafseer: Or do they have a god other than God? Glory be to God exalted is He above any partners that they may ascribe! to Him in the way of gods the succession of interrogatives with am ‘or’ are intended to express censure and rebuke.

Name: The Mount
Verse: And if they were to see a fragment of the heaven falling, they would say: A heap of clouds.
Tafseer: And if they were to see a fragment a portion of the heaven falling on them — as they say Then make fragments of the heaven fall upon us Q. 26187 as a chastisement for them — they would say this is ‘A heap of clouds!’ piled on top of one another that will bring us water; and so they do not believe.

Name: The Mount
Verse: Then let them be (O Muhammad), till they meet their day, in which they will be thunder-stricken,
Tafseer: So leave them until they encounter that day of theirs in which they will be thunderstruck in which they will die;

Name: The Mount
Verse: A day in which their guile will naught avail them, nor will they be helped.
Tafseer: the day when their guile will avail them nothing yawma lā yughnī is a substitution for yawmahumu ‘that day of theirs’ and they will not be helped they will not be protected from the chastisement in the Hereafter.

Name: The Mount
Verse: And verily, for those who do wrong, there is a punishment beyond that. But most of them know not.
Tafseer: And assuredly for those who do wrong by their persistence in disbelief there is a chastisement beyond that in this world before their death — thus they were punished with famine and drought for seven years and with being killed on the day of Badr; but most of them do not know that the chastisement will befall them.

Name: The Mount
Verse: So wait patiently (O Muhammad) for thy Lord’s decree, for surely thou art in Our sight; and hymn the praise of thy Lord when thou uprisest,
Tafseer: And submit patiently to the judgement of your Lord that they be reprieved and do not be grieved for surely you fare before Our eyes you are in Our sight We see you and preserve you. And glorify continuously with praise of your Lord that is to say say subhāna’Llāhi wa bi-hamdihi ‘Glory and praise be to God!’ when you rise from your sleeping-place or your sitting-place

Name: The Mount
Verse: And in the night-time also hymn His praise, and at the setting of the stars.
Tafseer: and glorify Him at night — also in actual utterance — and at the receding of the stars idbāra is a verbal noun that is to say also glorify Him after these have set; or it means in the case of the former perform the two evening prayers and in the case of the latter the two units rak‘a of the dawn prayer or — it is said — the morning prayer.

Name: The Star
Verse: By the Star when it setteth,
Tafseer: By the Star — the constellation Pleiades al-thurayya — when it sets when it disappears

Name: The Star
Verse: Your comrade erreth not, nor is deceived;
Tafseer: your companion Muhammad (s) may God bless him and grant him peace has neither gone astray from the path of guidance nor has he erred nor has he engaged in error al-ghayy is ignorance that results from a false belief;

Name: The Star
Verse: Nor doth he speak of (his own) desire.
Tafseer: nor does he in regard to what he brings you speak out of his own desire out of the whims of his soul.

Name: The Star
Verse: It is naught save an inspiration that is inspired,
Tafseer: It is but a revelation that is revealed to him

Name: The Star
Verse: Which one of mighty powers hath taught him,
Tafseer: it is taught to him by an angel one of awesome power

Name: The Star
Verse: One vigorous; and he grew clear to view
Tafseer: possessed of vigour of strength and might or alternatively it dhū mirratin means possessed of a beautiful appearance namely Gabriel peace be upon him; and he stood upright he settled

Name: The Star
Verse: When he was on the uppermost horizon.
Tafseer: when he was on the highest horizon the horizon of the sun that is to say at the place from which it rises in the form in which he Gabriel was created so that the Prophet s saw him; he the Prophet had been at Mount Hirā’ where Gabriel had obscured the entire horizon to the west. The Prophet fell down swooning after he had asked him Gabriel to show himself to him in the form in which he was created. Thus Gabriel had made a tryst with him at Hirā’ where he came down to him in human form.

Name: The Star
Verse: Then he drew nigh and came down
Tafseer: Then he drew near he came close to him and drew closer still

Name: The Star
Verse: Till he was (distant) two bows’ length or even nearer,
Tafseer: until he was from him the Prophet within the length of two bows away or even nearer than that until he the Prophet had regained consciousness and his fright had subsided

Name: The Star
Verse: And He revealed unto His slave that which He revealed.
Tafseer: whereat He God exalted be He revealed to His servant Gabriel what he Gabriel revealed to the Prophet s; the thing being revealed is not mentioned explicitly in exaltation of its great status.

Name: The Star
Verse: The heart lied not (in seeing) what it saw.
Tafseer: The heart the heart of the Prophet did not deny read khadhaba or kadhdhaba what he saw with his own eyes of the image of Gabriel.

Name: The Star
Verse: Will ye then dispute with him concerning what he seeth ?
Tafseer: Will you then dispute with him will you then argue with him and hope to overwhelm him concerning what he saw? — an address to the idolaters who denied the Prophet’s s vision of Gabriel.

Name: The Star
Verse: And verily he saw him yet another time
Tafseer: And verily he saw him in his true image another time

Name: The Star
Verse: By the lote-tree of the utmost boundary,
Tafseer: by the Lote-tree of the Ultimate Boundary when he was carried on the night journey up through the heavens — this lote-tree is a nabk thorn-tree that lies to the right of the Throne ‘arsh the tree beyond which no angel or any other being pass;

Name: The Star
Verse: Nigh unto which is the Garden of Abode.
Tafseer: near which is the Garden of the Retreat to which the angels the spirits of martyrs and the pious retreat;

Name: The Star
Verse: When that which shroudeth did enshroud the lote-tree,
Tafseer: when there shrouded the Lote-tree that which shrouded it of flying creatures and other beings idh ‘when’ is operated by ra’āhu ‘he saw him’

Name: The Star
Verse: The eye turned not aside nor yet was overbold.
Tafseer: The eye did not swerve on the part of the Prophet s nor did it go beyond the bounds that is to say his gaze did not turn away from the object of vision designated for it nor did it go beyond that object on that night.

Name: The Star
Verse: Verily he saw one of the greater revelations of his Lord.
Tafseer: Verily he saw in it some of the greatest signs of his Lord some of the most awesome of these signs. He thus saw from among the marvels of the Realm malakūt a green drape rafraf that obscured the entire horizon of the heaven and Gabriel with his six hundred wings.

Name: The Star
Verse: Have ye thought upon Al-Lat and Al-’Uzza
Tafseer: Have you considered al-Lāt and al-‘Uzzā

Name: The Star
Verse: And Manat, the third, the other ?
Tafseer: and Manāt the third of the preceding two the other? al-ukhrā a derogatory qualification of the third one. These were stone idols which the idolaters worshipped and which they claimed interceded for them with God the first direct object of a-fa-ra’aytum ‘have you seen’ is al-Lāt and what has been supplemented thereto; the second direct object has been omitted. The meaning then is ‘Inform Me do these idols have the power over anything such that you worship them besides God Who has the power over all that has been mentioned?’ And because of their assertion also that the angels were God’s daughters despite their aversion to daughters the following was revealed

Name: The Star
Verse: Are yours the males and His the females ?
Tafseer: Are you to have males and He females?

Name: The Star
Verse: That indeed were an unfair division!
Tafseer: That then would indeed be an unfair division! dīzān ‘unfair’ derives from dāzahu yadīzuhu to mean ‘he wronged him’ ‘he was unjust to him’.

Name: The Star
Verse: They are but names which ye have named, ye and your fathers, for which Allah hath revealed no warrant. They follow but a guess and that which (they) themselves desire. And now the guidance from their Lord hath come unto them.
Tafseer: These that is the mentioned deities are nothing but names which you have named by which you have named you and your fathers idols that you worship. God has not revealed any warrant any proof or evidence for them that is to say for the worship of them. They follow nothing but conjecture in their worship of them and that which ignoble souls desire of that which Satan adorned for them that they may intercede for them before God exalted be He even though guidance has already come to them from their Lord by the tongue of the Prophet s with definitive proof; yet they do not desist from their ways.

Name: The Star
Verse: Or shall man have what he coveteth ?
Tafseer: Or shall man that is shall every human being among them have whatever he wishes for? such as their wish that the idols intercede for them. No! It is not so.

Name: The Star
Verse: But unto Allah belongeth the after (life), and the former.
Tafseer: Yet to God belong the Hereafter and the former life that is to say the life of the world and so nothing comes to pass in them except what He exalted wills.

Name: The Star
Verse: And how many angels are in the heavens whose intercession availeth naught save after Allah giveth leave to whom He chooseth and accepteth.
Tafseer: And how many an angel that is to say many an angel there is in the heavens and how honoured they are in God’s sight but whose intercession cannot avail in any way except after God gives permission to them for this intercession for whomever He wills of His servants and with whom He is satisfied because of His saying and they do not intercede except for him with whom He is satisfied Q. 2128. It is also well-known that it intercession cannot be forthcoming from them except after permission for it has been granted who is there that shall intercede with Him save with His leave Q. 2255.

Name: The Star
Verse: Lo! it is those who disbelieve in the Hereafter who name the angels with the names of females.
Tafseer: Truly those who do not believe in the Hereafter give the angels the names of females for they say ‘They are God’s daughters’.

Name: The Star
Verse: And they have no knowledge thereof. They follow but a guess, and lo! a guess can never take the place of the truth.
Tafseer: But they do not have any knowledge thereof of this claim. They follow in this respect nothing but conjecture which they have conjured up and indeed conjecture can never substitute for the truth that is to say when it comes to acquiring knowledge of that which one is required to have knowledge of.

Name: The Star
Verse: Then withdraw (O Muhammad) from him who fleeth from Our remembrance and desireth but the life of the world.
Tafseer: So shun him who turns away from Our Remembrance that is from the Qur’ān and desires nothing but the life of this world — this was revealed before the command to struggle against the disbelievers.

Name: The Star
Verse: Such is their sum of knowledge. Lo! thy Lord is Best Aware of him who strayeth, and He is Best Aware of him whom goeth right.
Tafseer: That namely the desire of this world is the full extent of their knowledge that is the limit of their knowledge namely that they have preferred this life to that of the Hereafter. Truly your Lord knows best those who have strayed from His way and He knows best those who are rightly guided He has knowledge of both and will requite both.

Name: The Star
Verse: And unto Allah belongeth whatsoever is in the heavens and whatsoever is in the earth, that He may reward those who do evil with that which they have done, and reward those who do good with goodness.
Tafseer: And to God belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth that is He owns all of that among which also are the misguided one and the rightly guided one leading astray whomever He will and guiding whomever He will that He may requite those who do evil for what they have done by way of idolatry and otherwise and reward those who are virtuous by their affirmation of God’s Oneness and other acts of obedience with the best reward namely Paradise. He points out ‘the virtuous’ as being

Name: The Star
Verse: Those who avoid enormities of sin and abominations, save the unwilled offences - (for them) lo! thy Lord is of vast mercy. He is Best Aware of you (from the time) when He created you from the earth, and when ye were hidden in the bellies of your mothers. Therefor ascribe not purity unto yourselves. He is Best Aware of him who wardeth off (evil).
Tafseer: Those who avoid grave sins and abominations excepting lesser offences that is minor sins such as a look a kiss or a touch this constitutes a discontinuous exception in other words the meaning is but lesser offences are forgiven by the avoidance of grave sins. Truly your Lord is of vast forgiveness for such lesser sins and for accepting repentance. The following was revealed regarding those who used to say ‘What of our prayers our fasting and our pilgrimage!’. He knows you best from the time when He produced you from the earth that is to say when He created your father Adam from dust and when you were hidden fetuses ajinna is the plural of janīn in the bellies of your mothers. So do not claim purity for yourselves do not praise yourselves that is in admiration; but if it is done in recognition of God’s grace then that is fine. He knows best those who are God-fearing.

Name: The Star
Verse: Didst thou (O Muhammad) observe him who turned away,
Tafseer: Did you see him who turned away from faith — that is the one who recanted when he was derided for it. He said ‘But I fear the punishment of God!’. But when the one deriding him guaranteed him that he would bear God’s chastisement for him provided that he reverted to his former idolatry and he then gave him a stated sum money he reverted —

Name: The Star
Verse: And gave a little, then was grudging ?
Tafseer: and gave a little of the stated sum of money and was then grudging? refrained from giving the remainder akdā derives from al-kudya earth that is hard as rock and which prevents the well-digger from digging through when he hits it.

Name: The Star
Verse: Hath he knowledge of the Unseen so that he seeth ?
Tafseer: Does he possess knowledge of the Unseen so that he sees? and therefore from among such knowledge he is able to know that another person may bear the chastisement of the Hereafter for him? No! This was al-Walīd b. al-Mughīra or someone else the sentence beginning with a-‘indahu ‘does he possess’ is the second object of the a-ra’ayta ‘have you seen’ which has the significance of ‘inform Me!’.

Name: The Star
Verse: Or hath he not had news of what is in the books of Moses
Tafseer: Or am means bal has he not been informed of what is in the scrolls of Moses the books of the Torah or scrolls before it

Name: The Star
Verse: And Abraham who paid his debt:
Tafseer: and the scrolls of Abraham who fulfilled his summons he who completed what he had been charged with as in And when his Lord tested Abraham with certain words and he fulfilled them Q. 2124 the explication of mā ‘what’ is the following

Name: The Star
Verse: That no laden one shall bear another’s load,
Tafseer: that no burdened soul shall bear the burden of another an ‘that’ has been softened in place of the hardened form in other words no soul shall bear responsibility for the sins of another;

Name: The Star
Verse: And that man hath only that for which he maketh effort,
Tafseer: and that wa-an to be understood as wa-annahu man shall have only what he himself strives for of good deeds and so he shall not have anything of the reward for good deeds striven for by another;

Name: The Star
Verse: And that his effort will be seen.
Tafseer: and that his endeavour will be seen it will be inspected in the Hereafter

Name: The Star
Verse: And afterward he will be repaid for it with fullest payment;
Tafseer: then he will be rewarded for it with the fullest reward the most perfect reward one may say jazaytuhu sa‘yahu or jazaytuhu bi-sa‘yihi to mean the same thing

Name: The Star
Verse: And that thy Lord, He is the goal;
Tafseer: and that read wa-anna as a supplement; it is also read wa-inna as the beginning of a new sentence; and the same applies to what comes after it in which case according to this second reading these inna statements no longer form part of the content of all that is ‘in the scrolls’ the ultimate end the return and the destination after death is toward your Lord whereat He will requite them;

Name: The Star
Verse: And that He it is who maketh laugh, and maketh weep,
Tafseer: and that it is He Who makes to laugh whomever He will He makes joyous and makes to weep whomever He will He makes him sorrowful

Name: The Star
Verse: And that He it is Who giveth death and giveth life;
Tafseer: and that it is He Who brings death in this world and gives life for resurrection

Name: The Star
Verse: And that He createth the two spouses, the male and the female,
Tafseer: and that He Himself creates the two spouses the two kinds the male and the female

Name: The Star
Verse: From a drop (of seed) when it is poured forth;
Tafseer: from a drop of semen once it is emitted once it is poured forth into the womb

Name: The Star
Verse: And that He hath ordained the second bringing forth;
Tafseer: and that with Him rests the second genesis read al-nashā’ata or al-nash’ata the other creation for the Resurrection after the first creation

Name: The Star
Verse: And that He it is Who enricheth and contenteth;
Tafseer: and that it is He Who enriches people by granting them sufficient wealth and grants possessions He Who gives that wealth that is enjoyed as property

Name: The Star
Verse: And that He it is Who is the Lord of Sirius;
Tafseer: and that it is He Who is the Lord of Sirius — this is a star lying beyond the constellation of Gemini which was worshipped in the time of pagandom jāhiliyya;

Name: The Star
Verse: And that He destroyed the former (tribe of) A’ad,
Tafseer: and that He destroyed former ‘Ād ‘Ādan al-ūlā a variant reading elides the nunation with the following lām sc. ‘Āda’l-ūlā; this former one refers to the people of ‘Ād while the second ‘Ād is that of the people of Sālih

Name: The Star
Verse: And (the tribe of) Thamud He spared not;
Tafseer: and Thamūd wa-Thamūda may be declined as the name of their forefather or left as a diptote being the name of the tribe; it is a supplement to ‘Ādan sparing not a single one of them;

Name: The Star
Verse: And the folk of Noah aforetime, Lo! they were more unjust and more rebellious;
Tafseer: and the people of Noah before that that is to say before ‘Ād and Thamūd We also destroyed them; indeed they were more unjust and more insolent than ‘Ād and Thamūd because of the long time that Noah remained among them and he remained among them a thousand-less-fifty years Q. 2914 for they despite their disbelief in him would still harm him and assault him;

Name: The Star
Verse: And Al-Mu’tafikah He destroyed
Tafseer: and the Deviant cities namely the cities of the people of Lot He overturned He hurled them down to the earth after lifting them up to the heaven upside down by commanding Gabriel to do this;

Name: The Star
Verse: So that there covered them that which did cover.
Tafseer: so that there covered them of rocks afterwards that which covered them this is purposely left vague in order to inspire terror; in sūrat Hūd it is stated We made their uppermost the nethermost and We rained upon them stones of baked clay Q. 1182.

Name: The Star
Verse: Concerning which then, of the bounties of thy Lord, canst thou dispute ?
Tafseer: Then which of the bounties of your Lord which of His graces graces which indicate His Oneness and power do you dispute? do you have doubt about O man or deny?

Name: The Star
Verse: This is a warner of the warners of old.
Tafseer: This Muhammad (s) is a warner in the tradition of the warners of old of their kind that is to say he is a messenger like messengers before him sent to you just as they were sent to their peoples.

Name: The Star
Verse: The threatened Hour is nigh.
Tafseer: The Impending Hour is imminent the Resurrection is near at hand.

Name: The Star
Verse: None beside Allah can disclose it.
Tafseer: None no soul besides God can disclose it that is to say only He can disclose it and manifest it as where He says He alone shall reveal it at its proper time Q. 7187.

Name: The Star
Verse: Marvel ye then at this statement,
Tafseer: Do you then marvel in denial at this discourse the Qur’ān

Name: The Star
Verse: And laugh and not weep,
Tafseer: and laugh mockingly and not weep when you hear its Promise and Threat

Name: The Star
Verse: While ye amuse yourselves ?
Tafseer: while you remain oblivious? unmindful and heedless of what is required of you.

Name: The Star
Verse: Rather prostrate yourselves before Allah and serve Him.
Tafseer: So prostrate to God Who created you and worship Him! and do not prostrate to idols nor worship them.

Name: The Moon
Verse: The hour drew nigh and the moon was rent in twain.
Tafseer: The Hour has drawn near the Resurrection is close at hand and the moon has split it broke in two at Mount Abū Qubays and Qu‘ayqa‘ān as a sign for the Prophet s for it had been demanded of him and when it took place he said ‘Bear witness now!’ — as reported by the two Shaykhs al-Bukhārī and Muslim.

Name: The Moon
Verse: And if they behold a portent they turn away and say: Prolonged illusion.
Tafseer: And if they the disbelievers among Quraysh see a sign a miracle of the Prophet s they turn away and say this is ‘A powerful sorcery!’ mustamirr ‘powerful’ derives from al-mirra meaning ‘strength’; or it mustamirr means ‘incessant’.

Name: The Moon
Verse: They denied (the Truth) and followed their own lusts. Yet everything will come to a decision
Tafseer: And they denied the Prophet s and followed their own desires as regards their falsehood; and every matter that is good or evil will be settled with that person who is responsible for it either by his ending up in Paradise or in the Fire.

Name: The Moon
Verse: And surely there hath come unto them news whereof the purport should deter,
Tafseer: And verily there has come to them such tidings stories about the destruction of communities which denied their messengers as contain a deterrent to them muzdajar is a verbal noun or a noun of place; the dāl of muzdajar replaces the tā’ of the 8th form ifta‘ala; one may say izdajartuhu or zajartuhu to mean ‘I forbade him sternly’; mā ‘such as’ either indicates a relative clause or it is qualified by an adjective;

Name: The Moon
Verse: Effective wisdom; but warnings avail not.
Tafseer: wisdom hikmatun is the predicate of an omitted subject or a substitution for mā ‘such as’ or for muzdajar ‘deterrent’ that is far-reaching complete; but warnings nudhur is the plural of nadhīr functioning in the agent sense of mundhir ‘a warner’ that is to say ‘those matters which warn them’; mā is either for negation or it is an interrogative of denial in which case it stands as a preceding direct object are of no avail warnings are of no use with them.

Name: The Moon
Verse: So withdraw from them (O Muhammad) on the day when the Summoner summoneth unto a painful thing.
Tafseer: So turn away from them! this is the import of the preceding statement and it completes what is being said. On the day when the Summoner namely Isrāfīl yawma ‘the day’ is rendered accusative by yakhrujūna ‘they will emerge’ next verse summons to an awful thing read nukur or nukr in the sense of munkar ‘disagreeable’ a thing which the souls will find awful and this is the Reckoning;

Name: The Moon
Verse: With downcast eyes, they come forth from the graves as they were locusts spread abroad,
Tafseer: with their downcast khāshi‘an a variant reading has khushsha‘an humiliated looks absāruhum is a circumstantial qualifier referring to the subject of the verb yakhrujūna ‘they will emerge’ they that is mankind will emerge from the graves as though they were scattered locusts not knowing where to go out of fear and perplexity this sentence ka’annahum jarādun muntashirun is a circumstantial qualifier referring to the subject of the verb yakhrujūna ‘they will emerge’ and so is His saying muhti‘īna

Name: The Moon
Verse: Hastening toward the summoner; the disbelievers say: This is a hard day.
Tafseer: scrambling hastening with their necks stretched out toward the Summoner. The disbelievers among them will say ‘This is a hard day!’ a difficult one for disbelievers — as is stated in sūrat al-Muddaththir a day of hardship for the disbelievers Q. 749-10.

Name: The Moon
Verse: The folk of Noah denied before them, yea, they denied Our slave and said: A madman; and he was repulsed.
Tafseer: The people of Noah denied kadhdhabat has feminine inflection on account of the import referring to a feminine noun qawm ‘tribe’ before them before Quraysh. Thus they denied Our servant Noah and said ‘A madman!’ and he was reviled they repulsed him with insults and in other ways.

Name: The Moon
Verse: So he cried unto his Lord, saying: I am vanquished, so give help.
Tafseer: And so he invoked his Lord saying ‘I have been annī to be understood as bi-annī overcome so help me!’

Name: The Moon
Verse: Then opened We the gates of heaven with pouring water
Tafseer: Then We opened read fa-fatahnā or fa-fattahnā the gates of the heaven with torrential waters waters pouring down intensely

Name: The Moon
Verse: And caused the earth to gush forth springs, so that the waters met for a predestined purpose.
Tafseer: and We made the earth burst forth with springs that flowed forth and the waters the waters of the heaven and the earth met for a purpose a circumstance that was preordained a matter which had been decreed since pre-eternity namely their destruction by drowning.

Name: The Moon
Verse: And We carried him upon a thing of planks and nails,
Tafseer: And We bore him that is Noah on one a ship made of planks and nails dusur is what boards are fastened down with of nails and the like; the singular is disār similar in pattern to kutub kitāb ‘book’

Name: The Moon
Verse: That ran (upon the waters) in Our sight, as a reward for him who was rejected.
Tafseer: sailing before Our eyes that is in Our sights in other words it was being protected as retaliation jazā’an is in the accusative because of the implied verbal clause that is to say ‘they were drowned by way of revenge’ for the sake of him who was rejected namely Noah peace be upon him a variant reading for passive kufira has kafara ‘him who disbelieved’ in other words they were drowned as a punishment for them.

Name: The Moon
Verse: And verily We left it as a token; but is there any that remembereth ?
Tafseer: And verily We left it We preserved this deed as a sign for whomever might be admonished by it in other words the news of this deed became widely-known and endured. So is there anyone who will remember? anyone who will take heed from or be admonished by it? muddakir is actually mudhtakir but the tā’ has been replaced with a dāl likewise the dhāl and it the dāl has been assimilated with it the other dāl.

Name: The Moon
Verse: Then see how (dreadful) was My punishment after My warnings!
Tafseer: How dreadful then were My chastisement and My warnings? this is an interrogative meant as an affirmative; kayfa ‘how’ is the predicate of kāna ‘was’ and it is here being used to inquire about a ‘state’; the intention is to prompt those who are being addressed to affirm the fact that God’s chastisement of those who denied Noah was fully deserved.

Name: The Moon
Verse: And in truth We have made the Qur’an easy to remember; but is there any that remembereth ?
Tafseer: And verily We have made the Qur’ān easy to remember We have facilitated its memorisation and disposed it to serve as a source of remembrance. So is there anyone who remember? anyone who will be admonished by it and memorise it? the interrogative here is intended as an imperative in other words memorise it and be admonished by it; none of God’s scriptures is memorised by heart other than it the Qur’ān.

Name: The Moon
Verse: (The tribe of) A’ad rejected warnings. Then how (dreadful) was My punishment after My warnings.
Tafseer: ‘Ād denied their prophet Hūd and so they were chastised. How then were My chastisement and My warnings? how then was My warning them of the chastisement before it was sent down? In other words it was justified and He explains this chastisement by saying

Name: The Moon
Verse: Lo! We let loose on them a raging wind on a day of constant calamity,
Tafseer: Indeed We unleashed upon them a clamorous wind intensely noisy on a day of prolonged ill fortune nahsin mustamirr means either one of continuous ill fortune or one of severe ill fortune — and this was the last Wednesday of the month —

Name: The Moon
Verse: Sweeping men away as though they were uprooted trunks of palm- trees.
Tafseer: tearing people away wrenching them from the holes in the ground in which they had been embedded and flinging them down to the ground head first thereby crushing their necks and severing their heads from their bodies as if they were while lying in this mentioned state trunks of uprooted palm-trees severed and thrown on the ground — they are likened to palm-trees because of their tallness nakhlun ‘palm-trees’ is masculine here but feminine in sūrat al-Hāqqa nakhlun khāwiya ‘fallen down or hollow palm-trees’ Q. 697 in order to harmonise with the end-rhyme of the verses in both instances.

Name: The Moon
Verse: Then see how (dreadful) was My punishment after My warnings!
Tafseer: How then were My chastisement and My warnings?

Name: The Moon
Verse: And in truth We have made the Qur’an easy to remember; but is there any that remembereth ?
Tafseer: And verily We have made the Qur’ān easy to remember. So is there anyone who will remember?

Name: The Moon
Verse: (The tribe of) Thamud rejected warnings
Tafseer: Thamūd denied the warnings nudhur is the plural of nadhīr with the sense of mundhir that is to say they denied those matters which their prophet Sālih warned them of if they refused to believe in him and to follow him

Name: The Moon
Verse: For they said; Is it a mortal man, alone among us, that we are to follow ? Then indeed we should fall into error and madness.
Tafseer: and they said ‘Is it a mortal basharan is in the accusative because it is governed by a succeeding verb alone among us minnā wāhidan are both adjectives of basharan that we are to follow? nattabi‘uhu this explains the verb which renders it basharan ‘mortal’ accusative; the interrogative is meant as a negative in other words why should we follow him when there are many of us and he is only one among us and not a king? That is to say we will not follow him. Then indeed if we were to follow him we would be in error a parting with reason and insanity!

Name: The Moon
Verse: Hath the remembrance been given unto him alone among us ? Nay, but he is a rash liar.
Tafseer: Has the Reminder the revelation been cast read a-ulqiya pronouncing both hamzas or by not pronouncing the second one but in both cases inserting an intervening alif or leaving this insertion out upon him alone from among us? in other words nothing has been revealed to him. Nay but he is a conceited an arrogant and insolent liar in his saying that the mentioned has been revealed to him. God exalted be He says

Name: The Moon
Verse: (Unto their warner it was said): To-morrow they will know who is the rash liar.
Tafseer: ‘They will know tomorrow in the Hereafter who is the conceited liar and it is them for they will be chastised for having denied their prophet Sālih.

Name: The Moon
Verse: Lo! We are sending the she-camel as a test for them; so watch them and have patience;
Tafseer: Lo! We are sending the She-camel We will bring it forth out of the mountain the rock as they demanded as a trial a test for them that We may try them. So watch them O Sālih await to see what they will do and what will be done with them and remain patient istabir the tā’ here has replaced the tā’ of the 8th form ifta‘ala in other words endure their harm.

Name: The Moon
Verse: And inform them that the water is to be shared between (her and) them. Every drinking will be witnessed.
Tafseer: And inform them that the water is to be divided between them and the She-camel one day for them and the next for it every drinking every portion of water will be attended’ by the people drawing water on their designated day and by the She-camel on its day. They adhered to this regime but eventually became impatient with it and decided to slaughter the She-camel.

Name: The Moon
Verse: But they call their comrade and he took and hamstrung (her).
Tafseer: But they called their companion Qudār to slay it so he took he drew his sword and he hamstrung with it the She-camel in other words he slew her in compliance with their wish.

Name: The Moon
Verse: Then see how (dreadful) was My punishment after My warnings!
Tafseer: How then were My chastisement and My warnings? My warning them of chastisement before it was sent down? In other words it was justified. He explains it their chastisement by saying

Name: The Moon
Verse: Lo! We sent upon them one Shout, and they became as the dry twigs (rejected by) the builder of a cattle-fold.
Tafseer: Indeed We unleashed upon them a single Cry and they became like the chaff of a corral builder al-muhtazir is one who makes a pen from dried tree-branches and thorns for his sheep to protect them from wolves and beasts of prey; the fallen parts which they tread are called hashīm.

Name: The Moon
Verse: And in truth We have made the Qur’an easy to remember; but is there any that remembereth ?
Tafseer: And verily We have made the Qur’ān easy to remember. So is there anyone who will remember?

Name: The Moon
Verse: The folk of Lot rejected warnings.
Tafseer: The people of Lot denied the warnings they denied those issues of which they were warned by his Lot’s tongue.

Name: The Moon
Verse: Lo! We sent a storm of stones upon them (all) save the family of Lot, whom We rescued in the last watch of the night,
Tafseer: Indeed We unleashed upon them a squall of pebbles a wind hurling at them pebbles namely small stones a single one of these being no larger than the palm of the hand and they were destroyed; all except the family of Lot namely his two daughters together with him whom We delivered at dawn from among the dawns the morning time of an unspecified day had a specific day been meant for that mentioned dawn it sahar would have been treated as a diptote instead of the declined form saharin being a definite noun derived from al-sahar for with definite nouns one ought to use the preceding definite article al. So was the squall unleashed at first with the family of Lot still there? There are two opinions regarding this in the case of the former that it was unleashed upon them including the family of Lot the exception is understood as a continuous one while in the case of the latter opinion that they were delivered before the squall the exception is understood as a discontinuous one even if it ‘the family of Lot’ is actually subsumed by the collective noun ‘the people of Lot’ and so they were delivered as a kindness from God;

Name: The Moon
Verse: As grace from Us. Thus We reward him who giveth thanks.
Tafseer: as a grace ni‘matan is a verbal noun that is to say in‘āman ‘an act of grace’ from Us. So like that requital do We requite him who gives thanks for Our graces and is a believer or it means him who is a believer in God and His messenger and is obedient to both.

Name: The Moon
Verse: And he indeed had warned them of Our blow, but they did doubt the warnings.
Tafseer: And verily he had warned them Lot had threatened them of Our strike Our seizing them with chastisement but they disputed they contested and denied the warnings his warning.

Name: The Moon
Verse: They even asked of him his guests for an ill purpose. Then We blinded their eyes (and said): Taste now My punishment after My warnings!
Tafseer: And they had even solicited of him his guests that he should let them have their own way with those who had come to him as guests that they may do wicked things with them — and these guests were angels. So We blotted out their eyes We blinded them and made them without slits so that they were continuous folds of skin like the rest of the face by having Gabriel smack them with his wing. ‘So taste now so We said to them taste My chastisement and My warnings’ that is to say taste the effects and the substance of My warning and My threat.

Name: The Moon
Verse: And in truth the punishment decreed befell them early in the morning.
Tafseer: And verily there greeted them in the early morning the morning time of an unspecified day an abiding chastisement a permanent chastisement continuous with the chastisement of the Hereafter.

Name: The Moon
Verse: Now taste My punishment after My warnings!
Tafseer: ‘So taste now My chastisement and My warnings!’

Name: The Moon
Verse: And in truth We have made the Qur’an easy to remember; but is there any that remembereth ?
Tafseer: And verily We have made the Qur’ān easy to remember. So is there anyone who will remember?

Name: The Moon
Verse: And warnings came in truth unto the house of Pharaoh
Tafseer: And verily there came to Pharaoh’s folk his people together with him the warnings the warning by the tongue of Moses and Aaron but they did not believe.

Name: The Moon
Verse: Who denied Our revelations, every one. Therefore We grasped them with the grasp of the Mighty, the Powerful.
Tafseer: Rather They denied Our signs all nine of them which were given to Moses. So We seized them by way of chastisement with the seizing of One Who is Mighty Strong Omnipotent Powerful Whom nothing can thwart.

Name: The Moon
Verse: Are your disbelievers better than those, or have ye some immunity in the scriptures ?
Tafseer: Are your disbelievers O Quraysh better than those? mentioned beginning from the people of Noah to those of Pharaoh which is why they have not been chastised? Or have you O disbelievers of Quraysh been granted some immunity from chastisement in the Scriptures? the Books? the interrogative in both instances is meant as a denial in other words it is not so.

Name: The Moon
Verse: Or say they: We are a host victorious ?
Tafseer: Or do they the disbelievers of Quraysh say ‘We are a host that will be helped to victory’? against Muhammad (s)? When Abū Jahl on the day of Badr said ‘We are a host that will be helped to victory’ the following was revealed

Name: The Moon
Verse: The hosts will all be routed and will turn and flee.
Tafseer: The host will truly be routed and turn its back to flee and so they were defeated at Badr and God’s Messenger s was granted victory over them.

Name: The Moon
Verse: Nay, but the Hour (of doom) is their appointed tryst, and the Hour will be more wretched and more bitter (than their earthly failure).
Tafseer: Nay but the Hour is their tryst for chastisement and the Hour that is the chastisement thereat will be more calamitous greater in affliction and more bitter than the chastisement of this world.

Name: The Moon
Verse: Lo! the guilty are in error and madness.
Tafseer: Indeed the guilty are in error in the destruction of being killed in this world and in a blazing fire a fire that has been set ablaze musa‘‘ara that is fiercely ignited in the Hereafter.

Name: The Moon
Verse: On the day when they are dragged into the Fire upon their faces (it is said unto them): Feel the touch of hell.
Tafseer: The day when they are dragged into the Fire on their faces in the Hereafter and it is said to them ‘Taste now the touch of Saqar’ Hell’s affliction of you.

Name: The Moon
Verse: Lo! We have created every thing by measure.
Tafseer: Truly everything read inna kulla shay’in is in the accusative as a dependent clause because of a verb governing it have We created in a measure by ordainment bi-qadarin ‘in a measure’ is a circumstantial qualifier referring to kulla ‘every’ in other words ‘already predetermined’; a variant reading for kulla has nominative kullu as the subject the predicate of which is khalaqnāhu ‘We have created’.

Name: The Moon
Verse: And Our commandment is but one (commandment), as the twinkling of an eye.
Tafseer: And Our command for a thing which We want to bring into existence is but a single word like the twinkling of an eye in terms of speed and this is the saying of kun ‘Be’ whereat it comes into existence. His command when He wills a thing is just to say to it ‘Be’ and it is Q. 3682.

Name: The Moon
Verse: And verily We have destroyed your fellows; but is there any that remembereth ?
Tafseer: And verily We have destroyed the likes of you the likes of you in terms of disbelief from among past communities. So is there anyone who will remember? this is an interrogative meant as an imperative that is to say ‘Remember and be admonished!’.

Name: The Moon
Verse: And every thing they did is in the scriptures,
Tafseer: And everything they that is servants have done is recorded in the scrolls the books of the Guardian Angels al-hafaza

Name: The Moon
Verse: And every small and great thing is recorded.
Tafseer: and every small and great sin or deed is inscribed is recorded in the Preserved Tablet al-lawh al-mahfūz.

Name: The Moon
Verse: Lo! the righteous will dwell among gardens and rivers,
Tafseer: Assuredly the God-fearing will be amid gardens orchards and rivers the collective noun is meant here; a variant reading for nahar has the plural nuhur similar in form to asad ‘lion’ plural usud the meaning being that they will drink from its rivers water milk honey and wine;

Name: The Moon
Verse: Firmly established in the favour of a Mighty King.
Tafseer: in an abode of truth a place of truth wherein there is no idle talk or cause for sin — the collective noun maq‘ad is meant here; a variant reading has maqā‘id ‘abodes’ in other words they are in congregations in Paradise that are free from idle talk and cause for sin in contrast to the congregations of this world which are rarely free from such things syntactically this statement is considered a second predicate and also a substitution; it the ‘abode’ may be understood as being ‘one of truth’ regardless of whether one reads the substitution as being of the part for the whole or otherwise; before a King malīk this form is hyperbolic that is to say One of a mighty and vast kingdom Who is Omnipotent Powerful Whom nothing can thwart namely God exalted be He ‘inda indicates glorious rank and closeness to His bounty exalted be He.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: The Beneficent
Tafseer: The Compassionate One God exalted be He

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Hath made known the Qur’an.
Tafseer: has taught whomever He will the Qur’ān.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: He hath created man.
Tafseer: He created man the species mankind

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: He hath taught him utterance.
Tafseer: teaching him the coherent speech utterance.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: The sun and the moon are made punctual.
Tafseer: The sun and the moon follow a reckoning they move according to a strict calculation

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: The stars and the trees adore.
Tafseer: and the grass all stalkless vegetation and the trees that vegetation which possesses stalk prostrate comply with what is required of them.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: And the sky He hath uplifted; and He hath set the measure,
Tafseer: And He has raised the heaven and set up the balance He has established justice

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: That ye exceed not the measure,
Tafseer: declaring that you should not contravene that is to say so that you may not do wrong with regard to the balance that instrument with which one weighs.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: But observe the measure strictly, nor fall short thereof.
Tafseer: And observe the weights with justice fairly and do not skimp the balance do not decrease the value of what is being weighed.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: And the earth hath He appointed for (His) creatures,
Tafseer: And the earth He placed it He fixed it in place for all creatures man jinn and others.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Wherein are fruit and sheathed palm-trees,
Tafseer: In it are fruits and the familiar date-palms with sheaths the spathes containing its flowers

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Husked grain and scented herb.
Tafseer: and grain such as wheat and barley with husk and fragrant herb.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours graces will you deny? tukadhdhibān is mentioned thirty one times; the interrogative is meant to be understood as an affirmative judging by what al-Hākim al-Naysābūrī reported by way of an isnād from Jābir b. ‘Abd Allāh al-Ansārī who said ‘The Messenger of God s was reciting surāt al-Rahmān to us and when he completed it he said “What is wrong with you that you have been silent throughout? Verily the jinn are more responsive than you. Not once did I recite this verse to them — So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny? — but that they said ‘Not one of your graces our Lord do we deny for all praise belongs to You’ ”.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: He created man of clay like the potter’s,
Tafseer: He created man Adam of dry clay salsāl a dry hollow mud producing an echo if tapped resembling the potter’s fakhkhār clay that has been baked

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: And the jinn did He create of smokeless fire.
Tafseer: and He created the Jann the father of the jinn namely Iblīs of a smokeless flame of fire.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Lord of the two Easts, and Lord of the two Wests!
Tafseer: Lord of the two Easts the points of the winter sunrise and the summer sunrise and Lord of the two Wests likewise the two points of sunset.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: He hath loosed the two seas. They meet.
Tafseer: He has loosed the two waters the sweet and the salty; and so they meet in the perception of the eye.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: There is a barrier between them. They encroach not (one upon the other).
Tafseer: Between them there is a barrier by His power exalted be He. They do not overstep neither of the two encroaches upon the other to become mixed with it.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: There cometh forth from both of them the pearl and coral-stone.
Tafseer: From both of them from the point at which they seem to meet — but which is actually from only one of the two and that is the salt water — is brought forth yukhraju passive may also be read as active yakhruju ‘emerge’ the pearl and the coral marjān these are red pieces of shell or small pearls.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: His are the ships displayed upon the sea, like banners.
Tafseer: His are the crafted ships that sail in the sea appearing like landmarks like mountains in their tremendous size and height.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Everyone that is thereon will pass away;
Tafseer: Everyone who is on it that is on the earth of animal beings will perish man ‘who’ is used to indicate predominance of rational beings;

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: There remaineth but the Countenance of thy Lord of Might and Glory.
Tafseer: yet there will remain the countenance of your Lord His Essence the countenance of majesty magnificence and munificence towards believers through His graces to them.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: All that are in the heavens and the earth entreat Him. Every day He exerciseth (universal) power.
Tafseer: All that is in the heavens and the earth implore Him either by way of speech or by their very state of dependence on Him for the strength which they require for worship for provision forgiveness and other things. Every day all the time He is upon some matter something that He manifests in accordance with what He has decreed since pre-eternity such as the giving of life the bringing of death exalting and abasing individuals giving abundantly and withholding responding to a supplicating person and giving the one requesting something and so on and so forth.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: We shall dispose of you, O ye two dependents (man and jinn).
Tafseer: We will attend to you We shall turn to reckon with you O you two heavy ones! mankind and jinn.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: O company of jinn and men, if ye have power to penetrate (all) regions of the heavens and the earth, then penetrate (them)! Ye will never penetrate them save with (Our) sanction.
Tafseer: O company of jinn and humans if you are able to pass through to exit from the confines the regions of the heavens and the earth then pass through! — a command meant to challenge them to what they are incapable of doing. You will not pass through except with a sanction except with some power and you have no power for such a thing.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: There will be sent, against you both, heat of fire and flash of brass, and ye will not escape.
Tafseer: Against you will be unleashed a heat of fire shuwāz can either mean that the flame thereof has no smoke or that it does have it with it and a flash of brass without any flame and you will not be able to seek help you will not be able to defend yourselves against this nay it will drive you to the site of the Gathering.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: And when the heaven splitteth asunder and becometh rosy like red hide -
Tafseer: And when the heaven is split open when it becomes open with many gates in preparation for the descent of the angels and it turns crimson wardatan literally ‘a rose’ in other words red like this rose like tanned leather red skins in contrast to its the heaven’s usual appearance the response to idhā ‘when’ is along the lines of fa-mā a‘zama’l-hawli ‘How great will be the terror then!’.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? -
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: On that day neither man nor jinni will be questioned of his sin.
Tafseer: Thus on that day no man will be questioned about his sin nor any jinn about his sin; but they are questioned on some other occasion By your Lord We shall question them all Q.1592 al-jānn in this instance and in what will follow denotes the jinn and also in both cases al-ins denotes human beings.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: The guilty will be known by their marks, and will be taken by the forelocks and the feet.
Tafseer: The guilty will be recognised by their mark blackened faces and bruised eyes; so they will be seized by the forelocks and the feet.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: This is hell which the guilty deny.
Tafseer: ‘This is Hell which the guilty were wont to deny!’

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: They go circling round between it and fierce, boiling water.
Tafseer: They shall pass round they shall pace between it and boiling hot water water of extreme temperature which they are given to drink every time they call to be rescued from the heat of the Fire ānin is defective like qādin.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: But for him who feareth the standing before his Lord there are two gardens.
Tafseer: But for those who feared that is for every one of them or for all of them together the station of their Lord the standing before Him for the Reckoning and therefore refrained from being disobedient to Him there will be two gardens.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Of spreading branches.
Tafseer: Both with dhawātā the dual form of the regular form dhawāt with its lām its third consonant is changed into a yā’ abundant branches afnān is the plural of fanan similar in pattern to talal atlāl.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Wherein are two fountains flowing.
Tafseer: In both of them there are two flowing springs.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Wherein is every kind of fruit in pairs.
Tafseer: In both of them of every fruit fākiha of the fruits of this world — or it fākiha means all those things in which one delights yutafakkahu bihi — there are two kinds two varieties one juicy one dried and those which in this world are bitter like colocynth will be sweet therein.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Reclining upon couches lined with silk brocade, the fruit of both the gardens near to hand.
Tafseer: They will be reclining muttaki’īna is a circumstantial qualifier operated by an omitted verb that is to say yatana‘‘amūna they will enjoy bliss while reclining’ upon couches lined with heavy silk brocade istabraq thick or coarse silk the outer lining being of fine silk sundus. And the fruits of both gardens will be near so that it may be reached by the one standing up the one sitting down or the one lying down.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Therein are those of modest gaze, whom neither man nor jinni will have touched before them.
Tafseer: In them in the two gardens and what they comprise of upper chambers and palaces are maidens of restrained glances restricting their eyes to those spouses of theirs from among either the men or the jinn who are reclining maidens who have not been touched who have not been deflowered — and these maidens are either houris or women of this world who will have been created anew by any man or jinn before them.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: (In beauty) like the jacynth and the coral-stone.
Tafseer: It is as though they are rubies in their purity and pearls in their fairness.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Is the reward of goodness aught save goodness ?
Tafseer: Is the reward of goodness manifested through obedience anything but goodness? granted through bliss?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: And beside them are two other gardens,
Tafseer: And beside these two mentioned gardens there will be two other gardens in addition for those who feared the standing before their Lord.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Dark green with foliage.
Tafseer: Deep green mudhāmmatān this means that they are almost black on account of the intensity of their greenness.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Wherein are two abundant springs.
Tafseer: In both of them will be two gushing fountains rushing with water unceasing.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Wherein is fruit, the date-palm and pomegranate.
Tafseer: In both of them will be fruits and date-palms and pomegranates the latter two fruits being from among these fruits of the two gardens; but it is also said that they belong to the fruits of some other garden.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Wherein (are found) the good and beautiful -
Tafseer: In them that is in the two gardens and their palaces and what they comprise are maidens who are good in nature and with beautiful faces.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? -
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Fair ones, close-guarded in pavilions -
Tafseer: Houris hur this means maidens with intense black eyes set against the intense whiteness of the iris secluded concealed in pavilions made of studded gems annexed to the palaces like boudoirs.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ? -
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Whom neither man nor jinni will have touched before them -
Tafseer: Untouched by any man before them before these soon-to-be spouses of theirs or jinn.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Reclining on green cushions and fair carpets.
Tafseer: Reclining namely their spouses muttaki’īna syntactically it is as described above upon green cushions rafraf is the plural of rafrafa which can mean either ‘carpets’ or ‘cushions’ and lovely druggets ‘abqariyyin the plural of ‘abqariyya which are velvet carpets.

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Which is it, of the favours of your Lord, that ye deny ?
Tafseer: So which of your Lord’s favours will you deny?

Name: The Beneficent
Verse: Blessed be the name of thy Lord, Mighty and glorious!
Tafseer: Blessed be the Name of your Lord He of Majesty and Munificence as explained above; the word ism is extra.

Name: The Event
Verse: When the event befalleth -
Tafseer: When the imminent Event comes to pass when the Resurrection takes place

Name: The Event
Verse: There is no denying that it will befall -
Tafseer: there will be no denying its coming to pass there is no soul to deny it by repudiating it as it did in this world

Name: The Event
Verse: Abasing (some), exalting (others);
Tafseer: it will be abasing some exalting others that is it will manifest the abasing of some people by virtue of their admission into the Fire and manifest the exalting of others by their admission into Paradise.

Name: The Event
Verse: When the earth is shaken with a shock
Tafseer: When the earth is shaken with a violent shock

Name: The Event
Verse: And the hills are ground to powder
Tafseer: and the mountains are pulverised to tiny pieces

Name: The Event
Verse: So that they become a scattered dust,
Tafseer: so that they become a scattered dust the second idh ‘when’ is a substitution for the first idh

Name: The Event
Verse: And ye will be three kinds:
Tafseer: and you will be at the Resurrection three kinds categories

Name: The Event
Verse: (First) those on the right hand; what of those on the right hand ?
Tafseer: Those of the right hand those who are given their record of deeds in their right hand fa-ashābu’l-maymanati is the subject the predicate of which is the following mā ashābu’l-maymanati — what of those of the right hand? — a glorification of their status on account of their admittance into Paradise.

Name: The Event
Verse: And (then) those on the left hand; what of those on the left hand ?
Tafseer: And those of the left hand al-mash’ama means al-shimāl ‘left’ each of whom is given his record of deeds in their left hands — what of those of the left hand? — an expression of contempt for their status on account of their admittance into the Fire.

Name: The Event
Verse: And the foremost in the race, the foremost in the race:
Tafseer: And the foremost in the race to do good namely the prophets al-sābiqūna is a subject the foremost this repetition is to emphasise their exalted status; the predicate is the following ūlā’ika’l-muqarrabūna

Name: The Event
Verse: Those are they who will be brought nigh
Tafseer: they are the ones brought near to God

Name: The Event
Verse: In gardens of delight;
Tafseer: in the Gardens of Bliss

Name: The Event
Verse: A multitude of those of old
Tafseer: a multitude from the former generations thullatun mina’l-awwalīna the subject that is to say a group of individuals from communities of old

Name: The Event
Verse: And a few of those of later time.
Tafseer: and a few from the later ones from among the community of Muhammad (s) being the foremost from among the communities of old and this community the predicate is the following ‘alā sururin mawdūnatin

Name: The Event
Verse: On lined couches,
Tafseer: will be upon encrusted couches their linings woven onto rods of gold and jewels

Name: The Event
Verse: Reclining therein face to face.
Tafseer: reclining on them face to face muttaki’īna ‘alayhā mutaqābilīna constitute two circumstantial qualifiers referring to the subject person of the predicate ‘they’.

Name: The Event
Verse: There wait on them immortal youths
Tafseer: They will be waited on by immortal youths resembling young boys never ageing;

Name: The Event
Verse: With bowls and ewers and a cup from a pure spring
Tafseer: with goblets akwāb are drinking-vessels without handles and ewers abārīq are vessels that have handles and spouts and a cup ka’s is the vessel for drinking wine from a flowing spring in other words wine flowing from a spring that never runs out

Name: The Event
Verse: Wherefrom they get no aching of the head nor any madness,
Tafseer: wherefrom they suffer no headache nor any stupefaction read yanzafūna or yanzifūna respectively derived from nazafa or anzafa al-shāribu ‘the drinker became inebriated’ in other words they do not get a headache from it nor do they lose their senses in contrast to the case with the wine of this world;

Name: The Event
Verse: And fruit that they prefer
Tafseer: and such fruits as they prefer

Name: The Event
Verse: And flesh of fowls that they desire.
Tafseer: and such flesh of fowls as they desire for themselves to enjoy

Name: The Event
Verse: And (there are) fair ones with wide, lovely eyes,
Tafseer: and houris maidens with intensely black eyes set against the whiteness of their irises with wide eyes ‘īn the ‘ayn here is inflected with a kasra instead of a damma because it the kasra better harmonises with the yā’; the singular is ‘aynā’ similar in pattern to hamrā’; a variant reading for wa-hūrun ‘īn has the genitive case wa-hūrin ‘īn

Name: The Event
Verse: Like unto hidden pearls,
Tafseer: resembling hidden guarded pearls

Name: The Event
Verse: Reward for what they used to do.
Tafseer: a reward jazā’an is an object denoting reason or a verbal noun with the operator being an implicit verb in other words ‘We have appointed for them the mentioned as a reward’ or ‘We have rewarded them this’ for what they used to do.

Name: The Event
Verse: There hear they no vain speaking nor recrimination
Tafseer: They will not hear therein in Paradise any vain talk any lewd words or any sinful words

Name: The Event
Verse: (Naught) but the saying: Peace, (and again) Peace.
Tafseer: but only the saying ‘Peace!’ ‘Peace!’ salāman salāman substitutes for qīlan ‘the saying’ which they will hear.

Name: The Event
Verse: And those on the right hand; what of those on the right hand ?
Tafseer: And those of the right hand — what of those of the right hand?

Name: The Event
Verse: Among thornless lote-trees
Tafseer: Amid thornless lote-trees nabk trees

Name: The Event
Verse: And clustered plantains,
Tafseer: and clustered plantains banana trees weighed down with its load of fruit from top to bottom

Name: The Event
Verse: And spreading shade,
Tafseer: and extended shade one that is permanent

Name: The Event
Verse: And water gushing,
Tafseer: and cascading water running continuously

Name: The Event
Verse: And fruit in plenty
Tafseer: and abundant fruit

Name: The Event
Verse: Neither out of reach nor yet forbidden,
Tafseer: neither unavailable during certain times nor forbidden because of its cost

Name: The Event
Verse: And raised couches;
Tafseer: and mattresses that are raised on top of couches.

Name: The Event
Verse: Lo! We have created them a (new) creation
Tafseer: Verily We have created them with an unmediated creation namely the wide-eyed houris We created them without the process of birth

Name: The Event
Verse: And made them virgins,
Tafseer: and made them virgins immaculate — every time their spouses enter them they find them virgins nor is there any pain of defloration —

Name: The Event
Verse: Lovers, friends,
Tafseer: amorous read ‘uruban or ‘urban plural of ‘arūb meaning ‘a woman passionately enamoured of her spouse’ of equal age atrāb is the plural of tirb

Name: The Event
Verse: For those on the right hand;
Tafseer: for those of the right hand li-ashābi’l-yamīni is the relative clause of either ansha’nāhunna ‘We have created them’ or ja‘alnāhunna ‘We made them’ who are

Name: The Event
Verse: A multitude of those of old
Tafseer: A multitude from the former generations

Name: The Event
Verse: And a multitude of those of later time.
Tafseer: and a multitude of the later ones.

Name: The Event
Verse: And those on the left hand: What of those on the left hand ?
Tafseer: And those of the left hand — what of those of the left hand?

Name: The Event
Verse: In scorching wind and scalding water
Tafseer: Amid a scorching wind an infernal wind permeating the pores of skins and scalding water water of extreme temperatures

Name: The Event
Verse: And shadow of black smoke,
Tafseer: and the shade of pitch-black smoke

Name: The Event
Verse: Neither cool nor refreshing.
Tafseer: neither cool like all other shade nor pleasant nor agreeable in its appearance.

Name: The Event
Verse: Lo! heretofore they were effete with luxury
Tafseer: Indeed before that in the world they used to live at ease enjoying life’s comforts never wearying themselves with an act of obedience

Name: The Event
Verse: And used to persist in the awful sin.
Tafseer: and they used to persist in the great sin namely idolatry.

Name: The Event
Verse: And they used to say: When we are dead and have become dust and bones, shall we then, forsooth, be raised again,
Tafseer: And they used to say ‘What! When we are dead and have become dust and bones shall we indeed be resurrected? in both instances a-idhā and a-innā the two hamzas may be read either by pronouncing them fully or by not pronouncing the second and in either case inserting an intervening alif.

Name: The Event
Verse: And also our forefathers ?
Tafseer: What! And our forefathers too?’ read a-wa-ābā’unā with the wa- being for supplement the hamza a- for the interrogative; here and in the previous instance it is used to express ‘remoteness of probability’; a variant reading has aw-ābā’unā as a supplement with aw and that to which this is supplemented is the syntactical locus of inna and its subject.

Name: The Event
Verse: Say (unto them, O Muhammad): Lo! those of old and those of later time
Tafseer: Say ‘Truly the former and the later generations

Name: The Event
Verse: Will all be brought together to the tryst of an appointed day.
Tafseer: will be gathered for the tryst the time of a known day that is the Day of Resurrection.

Name: The Event
Verse: Then lo! ye, the erring, the deniers,
Tafseer: Then indeed you the erring the deniers

Name: The Event
Verse: Ye verily will eat of a tree called Zaqqum
Tafseer: will assuredly eat from a Zaqqūm tree min zaqqūm the explication of shajar ‘tree’

Name: The Event
Verse: And will fill your bellies therewith;
Tafseer: and fill therewith with the tree your bellies

Name: The Event
Verse: And thereon ye will drink of boiling water,
Tafseer: and drink on top of that the consumed Zaqqūm boiling water

Name: The Event
Verse: Drinking even as the camel drinketh.
Tafseer: drinking like the drinking read sharba or shurba verbal noun of thirsty camels’ hīm is the plural of masculine haymān and feminine haymā similar in pattern to ‘atshān ‘atshā ‘thirsty’.

Name: The Event
Verse: This will be their welcome on the Day of Judgment.
Tafseer: This will be the hospitality for them what has been prepared for them on the Day of Judgement the Day of Resurrection.

Name: The Event
Verse: We created you. Will ye then admit the truth ?
Tafseer: We created you We brought you into existence from nothing. Will you not then affirm this truth? in resurrection? For the One able to create from nothing is also able to repeat this creation.

Name: The Event
Verse: Have ye seen that which ye emit ?
Tafseer: Have you considered the sperm that you emit? the sperm you spill in the wombs of women?

Name: The Event
Verse: Do ye create it or are We the Creator ?
Tafseer: Is it you a-antum read by pronouncing both hamzas fully or by replacing the second one with an alif or not pronouncing it but inserting an alif between the one not pronounced and the other one or without this insertion in the four instances here and below who create it that is the sperm making it into a human being or are We the Creators?

Name: The Event
Verse: We mete out death among you, and We are not to be outrun,
Tafseer: We have ordained read qaddarnā or qadarnā death among you and We are not to be outmanoeuvred from We are not incapable of

Name: The Event
Verse: That We may transfigure you and make you what ye know not.
Tafseer: replacing you with We are not incapable of appointing your likes in your place and making you creating you in what you do not know in the way of forms such as apes or swine.

Name: The Event
Verse: And verily ye know the first creation. Why, then, do ye not reflect ?
Tafseer: For verily you have known the first creation al-nashā’ata a variant reading has al-nash’ata why then will you not remember? tadhakkarūna the original second tā’ of tatadhakkarūna has been assimilated with the dhāl.

Name: The Event
Verse: Have ye seen that which ye cultivate ?
Tafseer: Have you considered what you sow? what you stir of the earth to place seeds therein?

Name: The Event
Verse: Is it ye who foster it, or are We the Fosterer ?
Tafseer: Is it you who make it grow or are We the Grower?

Name: The Event
Verse: If We willed, We verily could make it chaff, then would ye cease not to exclaim:
Tafseer: If We will We could surely turn it into chaff dried vegetation producing no seed and you would remain zaltum is actually zaliltum the lām having a kasra inflection; but it has been omitted to soften it that is to say you spend all day bemused tafakkahūna one of the original tā’ tatafakkahūna letters has been omitted surprised by this and you would say

Name: The Event
Verse: Lo! we are laden with debt!
Tafseer: ‘We have indeed suffered loss! losing what we expended on the cultivation.

Name: The Event
Verse: Nay, but we are deprived!
Tafseer: Nay but we are deprived!’ prevented from reaping our provision.

Name: The Event
Verse: Have ye observed the water which ye drink ?
Tafseer: Have you considered the water you drink?

Name: The Event
Verse: Is it ye who shed it from the raincloud, or are We the Shedder ?
Tafseer: Is it you who cause it to come down from the rain clouds muzn is the plural of muzna or are We the Causer of its coming down?

Name: The Event
Verse: If We willed We verily could make it bitter. Why then, give ye not thanks ?
Tafseer: If We willed We could make it bitter salty undrinkable — why then will you not give thanks?

Name: The Event
Verse: Have ye observed the fire which ye strike out;
Tafseer: Have you considered the fire that you kindle? the fire which you produce out of the oil of green trees?

Name: The Event
Verse: Was it ye who made the tree thereof to grow, or were We the grower ?
Tafseer: Was it you who created the tree thereof trees such as the markh the ‘afār or the kalkh ‘fennel’ or were We the Creator?

Name: The Event
Verse: We, even We, appointed it a memorial and a comfort for the dwellers in the wilderness.
Tafseer: We made it a reminder of the fire of Hell and a boon a provision for the desert-travellers al-muqwīn derives from the expression aqwā al-qawmu ‘they have reached al-qawā or al-qawā’ that is al-qafr ‘desolate land’ which is a wilderness mafāza that has neither vegetation nor water.

Name: The Event
Verse: Therefor (O Muhammad), praise the name of thy Lord, the Tremendous.
Tafseer: So glorify exalt the transcendence of the Name ism is extra of your Lord the Tremendous God.

Name: The Event
Verse: Nay, I swear by the places of the stars -
Tafseer: Nay I swear fa-lā uqsimu lā is extra by the setting-places of the stars!

Name: The Event
Verse: And lo! that verily is a tremendous oath, if ye but knew -
Tafseer: And indeed it the swearing by these setting-places of stars is a tremendous oath if you only knew — if you were people of deep knowledge you would realise the magnitude of this oath.

Name: The Event
Verse: That (this) is indeed a noble Qur’an
Tafseer: This namely what is being recited to you is indeed a noble Qur’ān

Name: The Event
Verse: In a Book kept hidden
Tafseer: in a Book inscribed guarded preserved and this is the Mushaf;

Name: The Event
Verse: Which none toucheth save the purified,
Tafseer: which none touch lā yamassuhu is a predicate functioning as a prohibitive command except the purified those who have purified themselves of ritual impurities 5680 a revelation revealed by the Lord of the Worlds.

Name: The Event
Verse: A revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.
Tafseer: Do you then belittle do you take lightly and deny this discourse? the Qur’ān.

Name: The Event
Verse: Is it this Statement that ye scorn,
Tafseer: And for your livelihood in the way of rain that is to say the thanks for it you offer your denial? of God’s granting it to you by saying ‘We have rain because of this or that storm’?

Name: The Event
Verse: And make denial thereof your livelihood ?
Tafseer: And for your livelihood in the way of rain that is to say the thanks for it you offer your denial? of God’s granting it to you by saying ‘We have rain because of this or that storm’?

Name: The Event
Verse: Why, then, when (the soul) cometh up to the throat (of the dying)
Tafseer: Why then when it the spirit during the throes of death reaches the dying person’s throat hulqūm is the passage for food

Name: The Event
Verse: And ye are at that moment looking
Tafseer: and you are O you attending the dying person at that moment looking at him —

Name: The Event
Verse: - And We are nearer unto him than ye are, but ye see not -
Tafseer: and We are nearer to him than you are to know of his state but you do not perceive tubsirūna derives from al-basīra ‘perception’ that is to say you do not realise this —

Name: The Event
Verse: Why then, if ye are not in bondage (unto Us),
Tafseer: why then if you are not going to face a reckoning if you are not going to be requited by your being resurrected in other words why then if you are not going to be resurrected as you claim

Name: The Event
Verse: Do ye not force it back, if ye are truthful ?
Tafseer: do you not bring it back why do you not restore the spirit to the body after it has reached the throat if you are truthful? in what you claim the second law-lā ‘why … if’ is repeated to emphasise the first one; idhā ‘when’ is an adverbial particle qualifying tarji‘ūna ‘bring it back’ to which both conditions are semantically connected. The meaning is ‘Why do you not bring it back when in repudiating resurrection you are being truthful in this repudiation?’ That is to say ‘Let death also be repudiated as impossible in its case just as you claim that resurrection is impossible’.

Name: The Event
Verse: Thus if he is of those brought nigh,
Tafseer: Thus if he the dead person be of those brought near

Name: The Event
Verse: Then breath of life, and plenty, and a Garden of delight.
Tafseer: then repose that is there will be for him relief and a goodly provision and a garden of Bliss does this response belong to the ammā ‘thus’ or to in ‘if’ or to both? Different opinions are given regarding this.

Name: The Event
Verse: And if he is of those on the right hand,
Tafseer: And if he be of those of the right hand

Name: The Event
Verse: Then (the greeting) "Peace be unto thee" from those on the right hand.
Tafseer: then ‘Peace be to you’ that is then for him there will be peace by way of security salām from chastisement a greeting from those of the right hand arising from the fact that he is one of them.

Name: The Event
Verse: But if he is of the rejecters, the erring,
Tafseer: But if he be of the deniers the erring

Name: The Event
Verse: Then the welcome will be boiling water
Tafseer: then a welcome of boiling water

Name: The Event
Verse: And roasting at hell-fire.
Tafseer: and a roasting in Hell-fire.

Name: The Event
Verse: Lo! this is certain truth.
Tafseer: This indeed is the certain truth haqqu’l-yaqīn an example of an adjectivally qualified noun being annexed to its adjective.

Name: The Event
Verse: Therefor Therefor (O Muhammad) praise the name of thy Lord, the Tremendous.
Tafseer: So glorify the Name of your Lord the Tremendous as explained above in verse 74.

Name: Iron
Verse: All that is in the heavens and the earth glorifieth Allah; and He is the Mighty, the Wise.
