Verse: (Which yet is) no relief nor shelter from the flame.
Tafseer: which is neither shady neither protective unable to shade them from the heat of that Day nor of any avail against nor wards off from them anything of the flame the Fire.

Name: The Emissaries
Verse: Lo! it throweth up sparks like the castles,
Tafseer: Indeed it that is the Fire throws up sparks namely those flame that are thrown by it into the air huge like palace edifices in terms of their enormity and vertical extension

Name: The Emissaries
Verse: (Or) as it might be camels of bright yellow hue.
Tafseer: as if they were dark yellow camels jimālātun is the plural of jimalatun the plural of jamalun; a variant reading has jimālatun in terms of their shape and colour. In hadīth it is stated ‘The sparks of humans thrown into the air by the Fire are black as pitch qīr’; the Arabs call dark camels sufr ‘yellow’ because a touch of yellow is mixed with their blackish colour and therefore it is said that ‘yellow’ in this verse actually means ‘black’ on account of what has been mentioned; but some say no to this interpretation; sharar is the plural of sharāra; qīr is qār ‘pitch’.

Name: The Emissaries
Verse: Woe unto the repudiators on that day!
Tafseer: Woe to the deniers on that day!

Name: The Emissaries
Verse: This is a day wherein they speak not,
Tafseer: This namely the Day of Resurrection is the day in which they will not utter anything

Name: The Emissaries
Verse: Nor are they suffered to put forth excuses.
Tafseer: nor will they be given permission to offer excuses and so offer excuses fa-ya‘tadhirūna is a supplement to yu’dhanu ‘given permission’ but without being a direct result of it since it belongs within the confines of the general denial of permission in other words ‘there will be no permission hence no excuses’.

Name: The Emissaries
Verse: Woe unto the repudiators on that day!
Tafseer: Woe to the deniers on that day!

Name: The Emissaries
Verse: This is the Day of Decision, We have brought you and the men of old together.
Tafseer: ‘This is the Day of Decision. We have brought you O deniers from this community and the ancients together the ancients from among the deniers before you so that you will all be reckoned with and chastised together;

Name: The Emissaries
Verse: If now ye have any wit, outwit Me.
Tafseer: So if you have any stratagems any ploy to ward off your chastisement try your strategems against Me!’ — put them into effect!

Name: The Emissaries
Verse: Woe unto the repudiators on that day!
Tafseer: Woe to the deniers on that day!

Name: The Emissaries
Verse: Lo! those who kept their duty are amid shade and fountains,
Tafseer: Truly the God-fearing will be amid shades that is amid clusters of trees since there is no sun therein from whose heat to seek shade and springs issuing forth with water

Name: The Emissaries
Verse: And fruits such as they desire.
Tafseer: and fruits such as they desire this is meant to point out that eating and drinking in Paradise is done according to their desires in contrast to the case in this world where it is predominantly determined by what people are able to procure. It will also be said to them

Name: The Emissaries
Verse: (Unto them it is said:) Eat, drink and welcome, O ye blessed, in return for what ye did.
Tafseer: ‘Eat and drink in full enjoyment hanī’an is a circumstantial qualifier in other words mutahanni’īna for what you used to do’ in the way of obedience.

Name: The Emissaries
Verse: Thus do We reward the good.
Tafseer: Indeed so in the same way that We reward the God-fearing do We reward the virtuous.

Name: The Emissaries
Verse: Woe unto the repudiators on that day!
Tafseer: Woe to the deniers on that day!

Name: The Emissaries
Verse: Eat and take your ease (on earth) a little. Lo! ye are guilty.
Tafseer: ‘Eat and enjoy — addressing the disbelievers in this world — for a little time at the end of which comes death — this is meant as a threat for them. Indeed you are guilty!’

Name: The Emissaries
Verse: Woe unto the repudiators on that day!
Tafseer: Woe to the deniers on that day!

Name: The Emissaries
Verse: When it is said unto them: Bow down, they bow not down!
Tafseer: For when it is said to them ‘Bow down!’ perform prayer they do not bow down they do not perform prayer.

Name: The Emissaries
Verse: Woe unto the repudiators on that day!
Tafseer: Woe to the deniers on that day!

Name: The Emissaries
Verse: In what statement, after this, will they believe ?
Tafseer: In what discourse then after this namely the Qur’ān will they believe? In other words they cannot believe in any other of God’s Scriptures after having denied this Qur’ān since it comprises that inimitability i‘jāz which none of the others do.

Name: The Tidings
Verse: Whereof do they question one another ?
Tafseer: About what about what thing are they the people of Quraysh questioning one another?

Name: The Tidings
Verse: (It is) of the awful tidings,
Tafseer: About the awesome tiding this is the explication of that ‘thing’; the interrogative is meant to emphasise its magnitude — this awesome tiding is the Qur’ān comprising news of the Resurrection and so on which the Prophet s brought —

Name: The Tidings
Verse: Concerning which they are in disagreement.
Tafseer: concerning which they are at variance for the believers affirm it while the disbelievers repudiate it.

Name: The Tidings
Verse: Nay, but they will come to know!
Tafseer: No indeed! — a disavowal — they will come to know what will befall them for their rejection of it.

Name: The Tidings
Verse: Nay, again, but they will come to know!
Tafseer: Again no indeed! They will come to know! reiterated for emphasis; thumma is added here to declare that the second threat of chastisement is more severe than the first. God exalted be He then alludes to His power to resurrect saying

Name: The Tidings
Verse: Have We not made the earth an expanse,
Tafseer: Have We not made the earth a cradle a bed like a cradle

Name: The Tidings
Verse: And the high hills bulwarks ?
Tafseer: and the mountains pegs? with which the earth is tied down like tents are tied down with pegs the interrogative is meant as an affirmative.

Name: The Tidings
Verse: And We have created you in pairs,
Tafseer: And created you in pairs? males and females

Name: The Tidings
Verse: And have appointed your sleep for repose,
Tafseer: and made your sleep for rest? repose for your bodies

Name: The Tidings
Verse: And have appointed the night as a cloak,
Tafseer: and made the night a cloak? to cover you with its darkness

Name: The Tidings
Verse: And have appointed the day for livelihood.
Tafseer: and made the day for livelihood? a time for seeking livelihood

Name: The Tidings
Verse: And We have built above you seven strong (heavens),
Tafseer: and built above you seven mighty ones? seven heavens shidād is the plural of shadīda that is to say strong and sturdy unaffected by the passage of time

Name: The Tidings
Verse: And have appointed a dazzling lamp,
Tafseer: and set a radiant lamp? namely the sun

Name: The Tidings
Verse: And have sent down from the rainy clouds abundant water,
Tafseer: and sent down from the rain-clouds mu‘sirāt the clouds due to give rain similar to the term mu‘sir which denotes a girl nearing menstruation cascading water? pouring forth

Name: The Tidings
Verse: Thereby to produce grain and plant,
Tafseer: that with it We may bring forth grains such as wheat and plants such as figs

Name: The Tidings
Verse: And gardens of thick foliage.
Tafseer: and gardens orchards of intertwining foliage? alfāf is the plural of lafīf similar in pattern to sharīf ‘noble’ plural ashrāf.

Name: The Tidings
Verse: Lo! the Day of Decision is a fixed time,
Tafseer: Verily the Day of Decision for creatures is the tryst a time fixed for reward and punishment

Name: The Tidings
Verse: A day when the trumpet is blown and ye come in multitudes,
Tafseer: the day the Trumpet the Horn is blown yawma yunfakhu fī’l-sūri is either a substitution for or an explication of yawma’l-fasli ‘the Day of Decision’ the blower being Isrāfīl and you come forth from your graves to the site of the Resurrection in droves in diverse groups

Name: The Tidings
Verse: And the heaven is opened and becometh as gates,
Tafseer: and the heaven is opened read futtihat or futihat sundered for the descent of the angels and becomes as gates it becomes a heaven with gates

Name: The Tidings
Verse: And the hills are set in motion and become as a mirage.
Tafseer: and the mountains are set in motion dislocated from their positions and become as a mirage as fine dust that is to say like it in terms of its levity when in motion.

Name: The Tidings
Verse: Lo! hell lurketh in ambush,
Tafseer: Verily Hell lurks in ambush mirsādan in the sense of rāsidatan or mursidatan ‘lying in wait’

Name: The Tidings
Verse: A home for the rebellious.
Tafseer: for the rebellious the disbelievers who will not be able to avoid it it is a resort a retreat for them and so they will enter it

Name: The Tidings
Verse: They will abide therein for ages.
Tafseer: to remain lābithīna is an implied circumstantial qualifier in other words their remaining therein will be decreed to be therein for ages for endless epochs ahqāb is the plural of huqb

Name: The Tidings
Verse: Therein taste they neither coolness nor (any) drink
Tafseer: tasting in it neither coolness neither sleep something which they will not taste therein nor drink nor anything that is imbibed for the sake of its delightful taste

Name: The Tidings
Verse: Save boiling water and a paralysing cold:
Tafseer: except boiling water of extreme temperatures and pus read ghasāqan or ghassāqan which is the vile matter that is emitted by the bodies of the inhabitants of the Fire which is what they will indeed taste. They are given this pair of tortures

Name: The Tidings
Verse: Reward proportioned (to their evil deeds).
Tafseer: as a fitting requital one that accords with the nature of their deeds for there is no sin greater than disbelief and no chastisement greater than the Fire.

Name: The Tidings
Verse: For lo! they looked not for a reckoning;
Tafseer: Indeed they never feared any reckoning given their rejection of the Resurrection

Name: The Tidings
Verse: They called Our revelations false with strong denial.
Tafseer: and they denied Our signs the Qur’ān mendaciously

Name: The Tidings
Verse: Everything have We recorded in a Book.
Tafseer: and everything in the way of deeds have We kept count of have We recorded precisely in a Book as individual written records in the Preserved Tablet in order to requite creatures in accordance with them including the record of their denial of the Qur’ān.

Name: The Tidings
Verse: So taste (of that which ye have earned). No increase do We give you save of torment.
Tafseer: ‘So now taste! — in other words it will be said to them in the Hereafter when the chastisement has befallen them taste now your requital! For We will increase you in nothing but chastisement’ in addition to your due chastisement.

Name: The Tidings
Verse: Lo! for the duteous is achievement -
Tafseer: Truly for the God-fearing there will be a triumph a place of triumph in Paradise

Name: The Tidings
Verse: Gardens enclosed and vineyards,
Tafseer: gardens orchards hadā’iqa is either a substitution for or an explication of mafāzan ‘a triumph’ and vineyards wa-a‘nāban is a supplement to mafāzan ‘a triumph’

Name: The Tidings
Verse: And maidens for companions,
Tafseer: and buxom maidens kawā‘ib is the plural of kā‘ib of equal age atrāb is the plural of tirb

Name: The Tidings
Verse: And a full cup.
Tafseer: and a brimming cup wine filling the vessels in which it is in; in sūrat al-Qitāl it is said and rivers of wine Q. 4715.

Name: The Tidings
Verse: There hear they never vain discourse, nor lying -
Tafseer: They will not hear in it that is in Paradise when they drink wine and in other situations any vain talk any words of falsehood or lies between one another read kidhāban to mean kadhiban ‘lies’ or kidhdhāban to mean takdhīban ‘lying’ in contrast to what happens in this world when wine is drunk

Name: The Tidings
Verse: Requital from thy Lord - a gift in payment -
Tafseer: this will be a reward from your Lord in other words God has rewarded them with this reward as a gift ‘atā’an substitutes for jazā’an ‘reward’ that is sufficing that is abundant hisāban as meaning ‘abundant’ derives from their saying a‘tānī fa-ahsabanī ‘he gave me so abundantly that I said “that is enough for me”’ hasbī

Name: The Tidings
Verse: Lord of the heavens and the earth, and (all) that is between them, the Beneficent; with Whom none can converse.
Tafseer: from the Lord of the heavens and the earth read rabbi ‘from the Lord of’ or rabbu ‘He is the Lord of’ and all that is between them the Compassionate One likewise read rahmāni or rahmānu or read rahmānu with rabbi for the preceding Whom exalted be He they that is creatures will not be able to address that is to say not one of them will be able to address Him for fear of Him

Name: The Tidings
Verse: On the day when the angels and the Spirit stand arrayed, they speak not, saving him whom the Beneficent alloweth and who speaketh right.
Tafseer: on the day yawma is the adverbial qualifier for lā yamlikūna ‘they will not be able to’ when the Spirit Gabriel or God’s hosts and the angels stand arrayed saffan is a circumstantial qualifier in other words mustaffīna. They creatures will not speak except him whom the Compassionate One permits to speak and who says what is right from among the believers and the angels as if meaning that they will intercede for he whom He approves of.

Name: The Tidings
Verse: That is the True Day. So whoso will should seek recourse unto his Lord.
Tafseer: That is the True Day whose coming to pass is definite namely the Day of Resurrection. So whoever wishes to let him seek resort with his Lord a return to Him that is to say let him return to God by being obedient to Him so that he may be secure from chastisement in it.

Name: The Tidings
Verse: Lo! We warn you of a doom at hand, a day whereon a man will look on that which his own hands have sent before, and the disbeliever will cry: "Would that I were dust!"
Tafseer: Lo! We have warned you O disbelievers of Mecca of a chastisement that is near the chastisement of the impending Day of Resurrection — for anything that is impending is also near — the day yawma adverbially qualifies ‘adhāban ‘a chastisement’ by describing it when a person when every person will behold what his hands have sent ahead of good and evil and the disbeliever will say ‘O yā is a particle used to call attention to something would that I were dust!’ in other words and not be chastised. He says this when God exalted be He says to the beasts after each of them has retaliated against the other ‘Be dust!’.

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: By those who drag forth to destruction,
Tafseer: By those that wrest by the angels who wrest the souls of disbelievers violently;

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: By the meteors rushing,
Tafseer: by those that draw out by the angels who draw out the souls of believers gently;

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: By the lone stars floating,
Tafseer: by those that glide serenely by the angels who descend from the heavens with His command exalted be He;

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: By the angels hastening,
Tafseer: by those that race forward by the angels who race forward to Paradise with the souls of believers;

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: And those who govern the event,
Tafseer: and by those that direct the affair by the angels who direct the affairs of this world that is to say they descend with the directions for it from God the response to all of these oath clauses has been omitted understood to be something like la-tub‘athunna yā kuffāra Makka ‘you shall certainly be resurrected O disbelievers of Mecca!’ which is also the operator of the following clause

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: On the day when the first trump resoundeth.
Tafseer: the day when the Tremor quakes that is to say the first blast as a result of which everything will be shaken violently thus it the subject has been described in terms of the effect it produces

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: And the second followeth it,
Tafseer: and is followed by the Aftershock the second blast; between the two blasts is a span of forty years the sentence tatba‘uhā’l-rādifatu is a circumstantial qualifier referring to al-rājifa ‘the Tremor’ in other words the ‘day’ can adverbially accommodate both blasts and other events and so for this reason it can also properly function as the adverbial qualifier for the Resurrection that will take place after the second blast;

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: On that day hearts beat painfully
Tafseer: on that day hearts will be trembling frightened and anxious

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: While eyes are downcast
Tafseer: their eyes humbled abject because of the terror that they see.

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: (Now) they are saying: Shall we really be restored to our first state
Tafseer: They those of the mentioned hearts and eyes will say mockingly and in rejection of the Resurrection ‘Are we indeed read a-innā pronouncing both hamzas or by not pronouncing the second and inserting an alif between them in both cases and in both instances being restored as before? Shall we be restored to life after death al-hāfira is a noun signifying the ‘first part’ of anything from which is derived the expression raja‘a fī hāfiratihi to mean that so and so ‘returned whence he had come’.

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: Even after we are crumbled bones ?
Tafseer: What! When we have been decayed bones?’ nakhira a variant reading has nākhira ‘decayed and withered’ will we have life again?

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: They say: Then that would be a vain proceeding.
Tafseer: They will say ‘That return of ours to life then if it were true would be a ruinous return!’.

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: Surely it will need but one shout,
Tafseer: God exalted be He says But it the Aftershock which will be followed by the Resurrection will be only a single blast and so when it is blasted

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: And lo! they will be awakened.
Tafseer: behold then they all creatures will be upon the surface of the earth alive after having been dead inside it.

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: Hath there come unto thee the history of Moses ?
Tafseer: Have you O Muhammad (s) received the story of Moses hadīthu Mūsā operates the clause that follows

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: How his Lord called him in the holy vale of Tuwa,
Tafseer: when his Lord called out to him in the holy valley of Tuwā? — this is the name of the valley it may be read with nunation Tuwan or without — and He said

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: (Saying:) Go thou unto Pharaoh - Lo! he hath rebelled -
Tafseer: ‘Go to Pharaoh; he has indeed become rebellious he has exceeded all bounds with his disbelief

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: And say (unto him): Hast thou (will) to grow (in grace) ?
Tafseer: and say “Would you — I call you to — purify yourself tazakkā a variant reading has tazzakkā where the original second tā’ of tatazakkā has been assimilated with the zāy to purge yourself of idolatry by bearing witness that there is no god but God

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: Then I will guide thee to thy Lord and thou shalt fear (Him).
Tafseer: and allow me to guide you to your Lord to show you how to know Him ma‘rifa by way of proofs so that you may have fear of Him?” ’

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: And he showed him the tremendous token.
Tafseer: So he showed him the greatest sign from among His nine signs namely the glowing hand or the slithering staff.

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: But he denied and disobeyed,
Tafseer: But he Pharaoh denied Moses and disobeyed God exalted be He.

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: Then turned he away in haste,
Tafseer: Then he turned his back to faith going about in haste throughout the land causing corruption.

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: Then gathered he and summoned
Tafseer: Then he gathered he assembled the sorcerers and his armies and proclaimed

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: And proclaimed: "I (Pharaoh) am your Lord the Highest."
Tafseer: and said ‘I am your most high lord!’ above whom is no other lord.

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: So Allah seized him (and made him) an example for the after (life) and for the former.
Tafseer: So God seized him He destroyed him by drowning him as punishment for the latter that is to say these last words of his and for the former that is to say his saying previously ‘I do not know of any god for you other than me’ Q. 2838 — and between the two claims made by Pharaoh was an interval of forty years.

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: Lo! herein is indeed a lesson for him who feareth.
Tafseer: Assuredly in that which is mentioned there is a moral for him who fears God exalted be He.

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: Are ye the harder to create, or is the heaven that He built ?
Tafseer: Are you read a-antum pronouncing both hamzas or by substituting an alif for the second one not pronouncing it and inserting an alif between the one not pronounced and the former or without this insertion namely you the deniers of the Resurrection harder to create or the heaven which He has built? harder to create banāhā an explication of the manner of its creation.

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: He raised the height thereof and ordered it;
Tafseer: He made it rise high — an explication of the manner of its construction; in other words He made its vertical extension high; it is also said that samkahā means ‘its ceiling’ — and levelled it He made it even flawless

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: And He made dark the night thereof, and He brought forth the morn thereof.
Tafseer: and darkened its night and brought forth its day He exposed the light of its sun ‘night’ has been annexed to it the heaven because it represents its shade and likewise the ‘sun’ because it represents its light;

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: And after that He spread the earth,
Tafseer: and after that He spread out the earth He made it flat for it had been created before the heaven but without having been spread out;

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: And produced therefrom the water thereof and the pasture thereof,
Tafseer: from it He has brought forth akhraja a circumstantial qualifier with a suppressed preceding qad that is to say mukhrijan ‘bringing forth from it’ its waters by making its springs gush forth and its pastures what cattle graze of trees and herbage and what humans consume of foods and fruits the use of mar‘ā to express this of the earth is figurative

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: And He made fast the hills,
Tafseer: and has set firm the mountains on the face of the earth so that it stays still

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: A provision for you and for your cattle.
Tafseer: as a source of sustenance an object denoting reason for an implied verbal clause in other words fa‘ala dhālika mut‘atan or tamtī‘an ‘He did this to provide a source of sustenance’ for you and your flocks an‘ām is the plural of na‘am which are camels cows and sheep.

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: But when the great disaster cometh,
Tafseer: So when the Greatest Catastrophe befalls — the second blast —

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: The day when man will call to mind his (whole) endeavour,
Tafseer: the day when man will remember yawma yatadhakkaru’l-insānu substitutes for idhā ‘when’ his efforts in the life of the world in the way of good or evil

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: And hell will stand forth visible to him who seeth,
Tafseer: and the Hell-fire the consuming Fire is revealed for all to see for every on-looker the response to idhā ‘when’ is what follows

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: Then, as for him who rebelled
Tafseer: as for him who was rebellious who disbelieved

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: And chose the life of the world,
Tafseer: and preferred the life of this world by pursuing carnal desires

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: Lo! hell will be his home.
Tafseer: Hell-fire will indeed be the abode his abode.

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: But as for him who feared to stand before his Lord and restrained his soul from lust,
Tafseer: But as for him who feared the stance before his Lord his standing before Him and forbade the evil-bidding soul from pursuing desire that leads to perdition as a result of that person’s lusting after carnal desires

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: Lo! the Garden will be his home.
Tafseer: Paradise will indeed be the abode in sum the response to idhā ‘when’ verse 34 is that the disobedient one will be in the Fire and the obedient one in Paradise.

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: They ask thee of the Hour: when will it come to port ?
Tafseer: They that is the disbelievers of Mecca will ask you about the Hour when will it set in? when will it come to pass and when will it begin?

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: Why (ask they) ? What hast thou to tell thereof ?
Tafseer: What have you to do with the mention of it? in other words you have no knowledge of it in order to mention it.

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: Unto thy Lord belongeth (knowledge of) the term thereof.
Tafseer: With your Lord it belongs ultimately ultimate knowledge of it lies with Him; none other than Him has any knowledge of it.

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: Thou art but a warner unto him who feareth it.
Tafseer: You are only a warner for your warning will only benefit the one who fears it.

Name: Those Who Drag Forth
Verse: On the day when they behold it, it will be as if they had but tarried for an evening or the morn thereof.
Tafseer: The day they see it it will be as if they had only tarried in their graves for an evening or the morning thereof that is to say as if only one evening of a day or its morning the annexation of duhā ‘morning’ to ‘ashiyya ‘evening’ is valid on the basis of their contiguity since both constitute either side of the day; the annexation has also allowed for the word to fall in harmony with the end-rhyme of the verses.

Name: He Frowned
Verse: He frowned and turned away
Tafseer: He the Prophet frowned glowered with his face and turned away

Name: He Frowned
Verse: Because the blind man came unto him.
Tafseer: because the blind man came to him ‘Abd Allāh son of Umm Maktūm who interrupted him while he was busy with those notables of Quryash whose submission to God he was very eager for. The blind man was not aware that he was busy with these and so he called out to him ‘Teach me of what God has taught you’. However the Prophet s went off to his house. He was then reproached for this with what was revealed in this sūra. Afterwards whenever he came to him the Prophet would say to him ‘Greetings to him on whose account God reproached me!’ and would lay down his cloak for him.

Name: He Frowned
Verse: What could inform thee but that he might grow (in grace)
Tafseer: And how would you know? Perhaps he would cleanse himself yazzakkā the original tā’ of yatazakkā has been assimilated with the zāy that is perhaps he would purge himself of sins by what he hears from you

Name: He Frowned
Verse: Or take heed and so the reminder might avail him ?
Tafseer: or be admonished yadhdhakkar the original tā’ of yatadhakkar has been assimilated with the dhāl and so the reminder the admonition heard from you might benefit him a variant reading for tanfa‘uhu has tanfa‘ahu as the response to the optative statement.

Name: He Frowned
Verse: As for him who thinketh himself independent,
Tafseer: But as for the one who thinks himself self-sufficient through wealth

Name: He Frowned
Verse: Unto him thou payest regard.
Tafseer: to him you do attend tasaddā a variant reading has tassaddā where the original second tā’ of tatasaddā has been assimilated with the sād him you accept and turn your attention to;

Name: He Frowned
Verse: Yet it is not thy concern if he grow not (in grace).
Tafseer: yet it is not your concern if he does not cleanse himself if he does not believe.

Name: He Frowned
Verse: But as for him who cometh unto thee with earnest purpose
Tafseer: But as for him who comes to you hurrying yas‘ā is a circumstantial qualifier referring to the subject of the verb jā’a ‘comes’

Name: He Frowned
Verse: And hath fear,
Tafseer: fearful of God wa-huwa yakhshā is a circumstantial qualifier referring to the subject of the verb yas‘ā ‘hurrying’ — this being the blind man —

Name: He Frowned
Verse: From him thou art distracted.
Tafseer: to him you pay no heed talahhā the original second tā’ of tatalahhā has been omitted that is to say from him you are distracted by other things.

Name: He Frowned
Verse: Nay, but verily it is an Admonishment,
Tafseer: No indeed! do not behave like this. Truly it the sūra is or the verses are a reminder an admonition for all creatures —

Name: He Frowned
Verse: So let whosoever will pay heed to it,
Tafseer: so let whoever will remember it preserve it in his memory and thus be admonished by it —

Name: He Frowned
Verse: On honoured leaves
Tafseer: on leaves fī suhufin is the second predicate of innahā ‘truly it’ and what precedes it is a parenthetical statement that are honoured by God

Name: He Frowned
Verse: Exalted, purified,
Tafseer: elevated in the heavens purified exalted above the touch of devils

Name: He Frowned
Verse: (Set down) by scribes
Tafseer: in the hands of scribes who write it down from the Preserved Tablet

Name: He Frowned
Verse: Noble and righteous.
Tafseer: noble pious obedient to God exalted be He these being the angels.

Name: He Frowned
Verse: Man is (self-)destroyed: how ungrateful!
Tafseer: Perish man! accursed be the disbeliever! What has made him ungrateful? an interrogative statement meant as a rebuke — what has driven him to disbelief?

Name: He Frowned
Verse: From what thing doth He create him ?
Tafseer: From what thing has He created him? an interrogative meant as an affirmative which He then explains by saying

Name: He Frowned
Verse: From a drop of seed. He createth him and proportioneth him,
Tafseer: From a drop of sperm did He create him then proportion him in stages as a blood-clot then an embryo up to the last stage of his creation.

Name: He Frowned
Verse: Then maketh the way easy for him,
Tafseer: Then He made the way his exit from his mother’s belly easy for him;

Name: He Frowned
Verse: Then causeth him to die, and burieth him;
Tafseer: then He makes him die and buries him He places him in a grave that hides him;

Name: He Frowned
Verse: Then, when He will, He bringeth him again to life.
Tafseer: then when He wills He will raise him for the Resurrection.

Name: He Frowned
Verse: Nay, but (man) hath not done what He commanded him.
Tafseer: No indeed! Verily he has not accomplished he has not done what He his Lord commanded him to do.

Name: He Frowned
Verse: Let man consider his food:
Tafseer: So let man consider in reflection his source of food how it is determined and procured for him

Name: He Frowned
Verse: How We pour water in showers
Tafseer: that We pour down water from the clouds plenteously;

Name: He Frowned
Verse: Then split the earth in clefts
Tafseer: then We split the earth into fissures with vegetation

Name: He Frowned
Verse: And cause the grain to grow therein
Tafseer: and cause the grains such as wheat and barley to grow therein

Name: He Frowned
Verse: And grapes and green fodder
Tafseer: and vines and herbs qadb is moist qatt

Name: He Frowned
Verse: And olive-trees and palm-trees
Tafseer: and olives and date-palms

Name: He Frowned
Verse: And garden-closes of thick foliage
Tafseer: and gardens of dense foliage orchards teeming with trees

Name: He Frowned
Verse: And fruits and grasses:
Tafseer: and fruits and pastures abb is what cattle graze; it is also said to be ‘straw’

Name: He Frowned
Verse: Provision for you and your cattle.
Tafseer: as sustenance understand matā‘an as mut‘atan or tamtī‘an as explained above in the previous sūra for you and your flocks also as explained above.

Name: He Frowned
Verse: But when the Shout cometh
Tafseer: So when the deafening Cry the second blast comes —

Name: He Frowned
Verse: On the day when a man fleeth from his brother
Tafseer: the day when a man will flee from his own brother

Name: He Frowned
Verse: And his mother and his father
Tafseer: and his mother and his father

Name: He Frowned
Verse: And his wife and his children,
Tafseer: and his wife and his sons yawma ‘the day when’ is a substitution for idhā ‘when’ the response to which is indicated by what follows —

Name: He Frowned
Verse: Every man that day will have concern enough to make him heedless (of others).
Tafseer: every person that day will have a matter to preoccupy him a predicament to distract him from the affairs of others in other words every person will be preoccupied with his own self.

Name: He Frowned
Verse: On that day faces will be bright as dawn,
Tafseer: On that day some faces will be shining radiant

Name: He Frowned
Verse: Laughing, rejoicing at good news;
Tafseer: laughing joyous happy — these are the believers.

Name: He Frowned
Verse: And other faces, on that day, with dust upon them,
Tafseer: And some faces on that day will be covered with dust

Name: He Frowned
Verse: Veiled in darkness,
Tafseer: overcast covered with gloom darkness and blackness.

Name: He Frowned
Verse: Those are the disbelievers, the wicked.
Tafseer: Those the people of this predicament are the disbelievers the profligates those who have combined disbelief with profligacy.

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: When the sun is overthrown,
Tafseer: When the sun is folded away enfolded and stripped of its light

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: And when the stars fall,
Tafseer: and when the stars scatter when they are extinguished and hurtle down towards the earth

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: And when the hills are moved,
Tafseer: and when the mountains are set in motion when they are blown away from the face of the earth becoming as scattered dust

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: And when the camels big with young are abandoned,
Tafseer: and when the pregnant camels are neglected abandoned without a herdsman or anyone to milk them on account of the matter that has come over them — even though previously no wealth was dearer to them than these pregnant camels;

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: And when the wild beasts are herded together,
Tafseer: and when the wild beasts are mustered when they are brought together after being resurrected so that each of them may retaliate against the other before becoming dust;

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: And when the seas rise,
Tafseer: and when the seas are set afire read sujirat or sujjirat when they are set alight and become a mass of fire;

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: And when souls are reunited,
Tafseer: and when the souls are coupled when they are paired up with their bodies;

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: And when the girl-child that was buried alive is asked
Tafseer: and when the girl buried-alive the young girl buried alive for fear of shame and impoverishment asks — in rebuke of its slayer —

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: For what sin she was slain,
Tafseer: for what sin she was slain sa’alat ‘asks’ a variant reading has su’ilat ‘she is asked’ narrating the address directed to her to which she then responds by saying ‘I was slain without having committed any sin’;

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: And when the pages are laid open,
Tafseer: and when the scrolls the scrolls containing the deeds are unrolled read nushirat or nushshirat when they are unfolded and spread out;

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: And when the sky is torn away,
Tafseer: and when the heaven is stripped off torn away from its place just as the skin of a sheep is stripped off;

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: And when hell is lighted,
Tafseer: and when the Hell-fire is set ablaze read su‘irat or su‘‘irat when it is set alight;

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: And when the Garden is brought nigh,
Tafseer: and when Paradise is brought near when it is brought close to those who have merited it that they may enter it the response to idhā ‘when’ at the beginning of the sūra and all that has been supplemented thereto is the following

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: (Then) every soul will know what it hath made ready.
Tafseer: then a soul every soul at the time of the occurrence of the things mentioned which is the Day of Resurrection will know what it has presented of good or evil.

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: Oh, but I call to witness the planets,
Tafseer: So I swear fa-lā lā is extra by the receding planets

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: The stars which rise and set,
Tafseer: the movers the setters that is the five planets Saturn Jupiter Mars Venus and Mercury takhnusu means ‘they sink away’ during their orbit whereas we see stars at the end of their zodiacal course return to the start; taknisu means that they enter their kinās ‘hideaway’ in other words they retreat into their setting-places;

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: And the close of night,
Tafseer: and by the night as it approaches as it falls with its darkness or it means as it recedes;

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: And the breath of morning
Tafseer: and by the dawn as it breathes as it extends until it becomes broad daylight

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: That this is in truth the word of an honoured messenger,
Tafseer: truly this Qur’ān is the word of a messenger who is noble in the sight of God exalted be He — this being the messenger Gabriel it qawl ‘word’ has been annexed to him because he descends with it

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: Mighty, established in the presence of the Lord of the Throne,
Tafseer: powerful one of mighty powers eminent one of eminent status makīnin is semantically connected ‘inda ‘in the presence of’ in the presence of the Lord of the Throne that is God exalted be He;

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: (One) to be obeyed, and trustworthy;
Tafseer: obeyed there the angels obey him in the heavens trustworthy with the Revelation.

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: And your comrade is not mad.
Tafseer: And your companion Muhammad (s) wa-mā sāhibukum a supplement to the clause from innahu ‘truly this is’ up to the last of the oath clauses is not a madman as you claim.

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: Surely he beheld Him on the clear horizon.
Tafseer: For verily he Muhammad (s) saw him Gabriel in the form in which he was created on the clear horizon the highest one towards the east;

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: And he is not avid of the Unseen.
Tafseer: and he Muhammad (s) is not to be accused of knowing the Unseen what is hidden of the revelation and the tidings of the heaven a variant reading for bi-zanīnin has bi-danīnin meaning that he is not ‘niggardly’ with the Unseen so as to reduce something of it and not disclose it.

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: Nor is this the utterance of a devil worthy to be stoned.
Tafseer: And it that is the Qur’ān is not the word of an accursed satan eavesdropping stealthily.

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: Whither then go ye ?
Tafseer: So where are you going? So what path are you going to follow in repudiating the Qur’ān and turning away from it?

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: This is naught else than a reminder unto creation,
Tafseer: It is only a reminder an admonition for all worlds those of mankind and jinn

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: Unto whomsoever of you willeth to walk straight.
Tafseer: for those of you who li-man shā’a minkum is a substitution for li’l-‘ālamīna ‘for all worlds’ using the same preposition wish to go straight by following the truth;

Name: The Overthrowing
Verse: And ye will not, unless (it be) that Allah willeth, the Lord of Creation.
Tafseer: but you will not wish to go straight along the path of truth unless God the Lord of the Worlds of all creatures wills that you should go straight along it.

Name: The Cleaving
Verse: When the heaven is cleft asunder,
Tafseer: When the heaven is split open when it is rent asunder

Name: The Cleaving
Verse: When the planets are dispersed,
Tafseer: and when the stars are dispersed when they expire and begin to fall

Name: The Cleaving
Verse: When the seas are poured forth,
Tafseer: and when the seas are burst forth released one upon the other forming one mass of water so that the sweet water mixes with the salty;

Name: The Cleaving
Verse: And the sepulchres are overturned,
Tafseer: and when the tombs are overturned when their earth above them is dug up and its dead are raised the response to idhā ‘when’ and all that is supplemented thereto is the following

Name: The Cleaving
Verse: A soul will know what it hath sent before (it) and what left behind.
Tafseer: a soul every soul will know at the time of the occurrence of the things mentioned which is the Day of Resurrection what it has sent ahead in the way of deeds and what it has left behind of these and did not do.

Name: The Cleaving
Verse: O man! What hath made thee careless concerning thy Lord, the Bountiful,
Tafseer: O disbelieving man! What has deceived you with regard to your generous Lord? so that you have disobeyed Him

Name: The Cleaving
Verse: Who created thee, then fashioned, then proportioned thee ?
Tafseer: Who created you when you were not then made you upright in your created form with sound limbs then proportioned you read fa-‘adalak or fa-‘addalak making you symmetrical in shape with well-proportioned parts so that no hand or leg is longer than the other

Name: The Cleaving
Verse: Into whatsoever form He will, He casteth thee.
Tafseer: assembling you in whatever mā is a relative form He will?

Name: The Cleaving
Verse: Nay, but ye deny the Judgment.
Tafseer: No indeed! — a deterrent against letting oneself be misled by the generosity of God exalted be He. Rather you that is disbelievers of Mecca deny Judgement requital for deeds;

Name: The Cleaving
Verse: Lo! there are above you guardians,
Tafseer: Yet lo! there are above you watchers from among the angels over your deeds

Name: The Cleaving
Verse: Generous and recording,
Tafseer: noble in God’s sight writers of these deeds

Name: The Cleaving
Verse: Who know (all) that ye do.
Tafseer: who know whatever you do all of it.

Name: The Cleaving
Verse: Lo! the righteous verily will be in delight.
Tafseer: Indeed the pious the believers who are sincere in their faith shall be amid bliss in Paradise

Name: The Cleaving
Verse: And lo! the wicked verily will be in hell;
Tafseer: and indeed the profligates the disbelievers shall be in Hell-fire a scorching fire

Name: The Cleaving
Verse: They will burn therein on the Day of Judgment,
Tafseer: entering it to suffer its heat on the Day of Judgement the Day of Requital

Name: The Cleaving
Verse: And will not be absent thence.
Tafseer: and they shall not be absent from it they shall not be taken out of it.

Name: The Cleaving
Verse: Ah, what will convey unto thee what the Day of Judgment is!
Tafseer: And what would show you what would inform you what the Day of Judgement is?

Name: The Cleaving
Verse: Again, what will convey unto thee what the Day of Judgment is!
Tafseer: Again what would show you what the Day of Judgement is? — repeated to emphasise its enormity.

Name: The Cleaving
Verse: A day on which no soul hath power at all for any (other) soul. The (absolute) command on that day is Allah’s.
Tafseer: It is a day read yawmu when no soul will be of any avail any use to another soul and the absolute command on that day will be God’s there will be no power of command for anyone other than Him thereat in other words none has been given the power to mediate thereupon in contrast to situations in this world.

Name: Defrauding
Verse: Woe unto the defrauders:
Tafseer: Woe waylun a term entailing chastisement; or it is the name of a valley in Hell to the defrauders

Name: Defrauding
Verse: Those who when they take the measure from mankind demand it full,
Tafseer: those who when they take measure from people demand it in full the measure;

Name: Defrauding
Verse: But if they measure unto them or weight for them, they cause them loss.
Tafseer: but who when they measure for them or weigh for them they cause them loss they diminish for them the measure or the weight.

Name: Defrauding
Verse: Do such (men) not consider that they will be raised again
Tafseer: Do such individuals not know for certain alā indicates an interrogative of rebuke that they will be resurrected

Name: Defrauding
Verse: Unto an Awful Day,
Tafseer: for an awful day that is to say on it and this is the Day of Resurrection

Name: Defrauding
Verse: The day when (all) mankind stand before the Lord of the Worlds ?
Tafseer: a day when yawma is a substitution for the syntactical locus of li-yawmin ‘to an awful day’ and as such is in the accusative because of the verb mab‘ūthūna ‘will be resurrected’ mankind will rise from their graves before the Lord of the Worlds? the Lord of all creatures for His affair His reckoning and His requital.

Name: Defrauding
Verse: Nay, but the record of the vile is in Sijjin -
Tafseer: Nay! verily the record of the profligates that is to say the record of the deeds of the disbelievers is in Sijjīn — this is said to be a book containing the record of all the deeds of the devils and the disbelievers; but it is also said to be a location in the lowermost part of the seventh earth the place of Satan and his hosts.

Name: Defrauding
Verse: Ah! what will convey unto thee what Sijjin is! -
Tafseer: And what would tell you what Sijjīn is? what the book of Sijjīn is.

Name: Defrauding
Verse: A written record.
Tafseer: It is a sealed book.

Name: Defrauding
Verse: Woe unto the repudiators on that day!
Tafseer: Woe to the deniers on that day

Name: Defrauding
Verse: Those who deny the Day of Judgment
Tafseer: who deny the Day of Judgement the Day of Requital alladhīna yukadhdhibūna bi-yawmi’l-dīn either a substitution for or an explication of al-mukadhdhibīna ‘the deniers’;

Name: Defrauding
Verse: Which none denieth save each criminal transgressor,
Tafseer: and none deny it but every sinful the form athīm is hyperbolic transgressor overstepping the bounds.

Name: Defrauding
Verse: Who, when thou readest unto him Our revelations, saith: (Mere) fables of the men of old.
Tafseer: When Our signs of the Qur’ān are recited to him he says ‘Mere fables asātīr of the ancients!’ mere tales that were written down sutirat in ancient times asātīr is the plural of ustūra or istāra.

Name: Defrauding
Verse: Nay, but that which they have earned is rust upon their hearts.
Tafseer: No indeed! — a deterrent and a warning against saying such things. Rather there has slayed engulfed their hearts covering them like rust that which they earned of acts of disobedience.

Name: Defrauding
Verse: Nay, but surely on that day they will be covered from (the mercy of) their Lord.
Tafseer: Nay! verily they on that day the Day of Resurrection will be screened off from their Lord and so they will not see Him.

Name: Defrauding
Verse: Then lo! they verily will burn in hell,
Tafseer: Then they will be exposed to Hell-fire then they will enter the scorching Fire;

Name: Defrauding
Verse: And it will be said (unto them): This is that which ye used to deny.
Tafseer: then it will be said to them ‘This that is the chastisement is that which you used to deny!’

Name: Defrauding
Verse: Nay, but the record of the righteous is in ’Illiyin -
Tafseer: Nay! verily the record of the pious that is the record of the deeds of the believers who were sincere in their faith is in ‘Illiyyūn — this is said to be the book containing all the good deeds of the angels and the believers from among the two heavy ones sc. mankind and jinn; but it is also said to be a place below the Throne in the seventh heaven;

Name: Defrauding
Verse: Ah, what will convey unto thee what ’Illiyin is! -
Tafseer: and what will tell you what will inform you what ‘Illiyyūn is? what the book of ‘Illiyyūn is.

Name: Defrauding
Verse: A written record,
Tafseer: It is a sealed book

Name: Defrauding
Verse: Attested by those who are brought near (unto their Lord).
Tafseer: witnessed by those brought near from among the angels.

Name: Defrauding
Verse: Lo! the righteous verily are in delight,
Tafseer: Assuredly the pious will be amid bliss in Paradise

Name: Defrauding
Verse: On couches, gazing,
Tafseer: upon couches upon beds beneath canopies gazing at the bliss which they have been given.

Name: Defrauding
Verse: Thou wilt know in their faces the radiance of delight.
Tafseer: You will perceive in their faces the radiancy of bliss the splendour and beauty of blissfulness

Name: Defrauding
Verse: They are given to drink of a pure wine, sealed,
Tafseer: as they are given to drink a nectar a wine free of any impurities that is sealed in its vessel none other than them breaking its seal

Name: Defrauding
Verse: Whose seal is musk - for this let (all) those strive who strive for bliss -
Tafseer: whose seal is musk that is whose final sip is followed by an emanating scent of musk — so for such bliss let the viers vie let them desire to apply themselves to obedience of God —

Name: Defrauding
Verse: And mixed with water of Tasnim,
Tafseer: and whose mixture that is to say that with which it is mixed is of Tasnīm which is explained by His following words

Name: Defrauding
Verse: A spring whence those brought near (to Allah) drink.
Tafseer: a spring ‘aynan is in the accusative because of an implicit prefatory amdahu ‘I extol this spring’ from which those brought near will drink yashrabu bihā should be yashrabu minhā or it may be that bihā is used because yashrabu is meant to imply the sense of yaltadhdhu bihā ‘in which they delight’.

Name: Defrauding
Verse: Lo! the guilty used to laugh at those who believed,
Tafseer: Verily the guilty like Abū Jahl and his ilk used to laugh at the believers such as ‘Ammār b. Yāsir and Bilāl the Ethiopian and those like them in mockery of them;

Name: Defrauding
Verse: And wink one to another when they passed them;
Tafseer: and when they the believers passed them by they would wink at one another the guilty beckoned with their eyebrows and eyelids towards the believers in mockery;

Name: Defrauding
Verse: And when they returned to their own folk, they returned jesting;
Tafseer: and when they returned to their folks they would return blithely fākihīna a variant reading has fakihīna rejoicing in their disparaging mention of the believers;

Name: Defrauding
Verse: And when they saw them they said: Lo! these have gone astray.
Tafseer: and when they see them that is the believers they say ‘Lo! these men are astray!’ on account of their belief in Muhammad (s).

Name: Defrauding
Verse: Yet they were not sent as guardians over them.
Tafseer: God exalted be He says Yet they that is the disbelievers were not sent as watchers over them over the believers to preserve them or to keep a record of their deeds and thus guide them back to what is best for them.

Name: Defrauding
Verse: This day it is those who believe who have the laugh of disbelievers,
Tafseer: So today that is the Day of Resurrection the believers will be laughing at the disbelievers

Name: Defrauding
Verse: On high couches, gazing.
Tafseer: upon couches in Paradise gazing out from their dwellings at the disbelievers while they are being tortured; and they will laugh at them just as they the disbelievers had laughed at them in the world.

Name: Defrauding
Verse: Are not the disbelievers paid for what they used to do ?
Tafseer: Have the disbelievers been requited for what they used to do? Yes indeed!

Name: The Sundering
Verse: When the heaven is split asunder
Tafseer: When the heaven is rent asunder

Name: The Sundering
Verse: And attentive to her Lord in fear,
Tafseer: and heeds gives ear to and in rending itself asunder obeys its Lord as it should that is as its duty is to heed and obey

Name: The Sundering
Verse: And when the earth is spread out
Tafseer: and when the earth is stretched out when its width is increased just as a piece of leather is stretched so that no edifice or mountain remains upon it

Name: The Sundering
Verse: And hath cast out all that was in her, and is empty
Tafseer: and casts out all that is in it of the dead onto its surface and empties itself thereof

Name: The Sundering
Verse: And attentive to her Lord in fear!
Tafseer: and heeds and in this respect gives ear to and obeys its Lord as it should all of this will be on the Day of Resurrection the response to idhā ‘when’ and to all that is supplemented thereto has been omitted; but it is indicated by what follows it and is implied to be something like laqiya’l-insānu ‘amalahu ‘man will encounter his deeds’.

Name: The Sundering
Verse: Thou, verily, O man, art working toward thy Lord a work which thou wilt meet (in His presence).
Tafseer: O man! Verily you are labouring exerting your efforts toward the encounter with your Lord that is death laboriously and you will encounter it that is you will encounter your mentioned good or evil deeds on the Day of Resurrection.

Name: The Sundering
Verse: Then whoso is given his account in his right hand
Tafseer: Then as for him who is given his book the record of his deeds in his right hand — and this is the believer —

Name: The Sundering
Verse: He truly will receive an easy reckoning
Tafseer: he will receive an easy reckoning which simply entails the presentation of his deeds to him as in the hadīth of the two Sahīhs of Bukhārī and Muslim — in which there is also a hadīth saying ‘He who is reckoned with at length will be destined for perdition’ — and after this presentation of his deeds to the believer he will be excused

Name: The Sundering
Verse: And will return unto his folk in joy.
Tafseer: and return to his family in Paradise joyful because of it.

Name: The Sundering
Verse: But whoso is given his account behind his back,
Tafseer: But as for him who is given his book from behind his back — and this is the disbeliever whose right hand is chained to his neck and whose left hand by which he is given the book is placed behind his back

Name: The Sundering
Verse: He surely will invoke destruction
Tafseer: he will pray upon seeing what is in it for annihilation he will invoke destruction against himself by saying yā thabūrāh ‘O annihilation of mine!’

Name: The Sundering
Verse: And be thrown to scorching fire.
Tafseer: and he will enter the Blaze an intense fire a variant reading for yaslā ‘he will enter’ has yusallā ‘he will be admitted’.

Name: The Sundering
Verse: He verily lived joyous with his folk,
Tafseer: Indeed among his folk his clan in the world he used to be joyful wanton lusting after his desires;

Name: The Sundering
Verse: He verily deemed that he would never return (unto Allah).
Tafseer: indeed he thought that an softened in place of the hardened form with its subject omitted that is to say annahu he would never return to his Lord.

Name: The Sundering
Verse: Nay, but lo! his Lord is ever looking on him!
Tafseer: Nay! he will return to Him; indeed his Lord is ever Seer of him knowing that he would return to Him.

Name: The Sundering
Verse: Oh, I swear by the afterglow of sunset,
Tafseer: So I swear fa-lā lā is extra by the twilight al-shafaq the reddishness visible in the horizon after the sunset

Name: The Sundering
Verse: And by the night and all that it enshroudeth,
Tafseer: and by the night and what it envelops what it brings together of creatures and otherwise that have entered into it

Name: The Sundering
Verse: And by the moon when she is at the full,
Tafseer: and by the moon when it is at the full and its light is complete and this happens during the nights of the full moon

Name: The Sundering
Verse: That ye shall journey on from plane to plane.
Tafseer: you will surely journey tarkabunna is actually tarkabūnanna but the nūn of the indicative has been omitted because of two identical letters following one another and the wāw is omitted because of two unvocalised consonants coming together from stage to stage state after state namely death then life then what comes afterwards of the states at the Resurrection.

Name: The Sundering
Verse: What aileth them, then, that they believe not
Tafseer: So what is wrong with them that is the disbelievers that they do not have faith that is to say what is there to prevent them from embracing faith; or what argument do they have for neglecting it despite the existence of proofs for it

Name: The Sundering
Verse: And, when the Qur’an is recited unto them, worship not (Allah) ?
Tafseer: and what is wrong with them that when the Qur’ān is recited to them they do not prostrate? they do not submit by believing in it given its inimitability?

Name: The Sundering
Verse: Nay, but those who disbelieve will deny;
Tafseer: Nay but the disbelievers deny resurrection and other matters

Name: The Sundering
Verse: And Allah knoweth best what they are hiding.
Tafseer: and God knows best what they are amassing accumulating in their scrolls in the way of disbelief denial and evil deeds.

Name: The Sundering
Verse: So give them tidings of a painful doom,
Tafseer: So give them good tidings inform them of a painful chastisement

Name: The Sundering
Verse: Save those who believe and do good works, for theirs is a reward unfailing.
Tafseer: except those who believe and perform righteous deeds theirs will be an unfailing reward one that is unending undiminished and not given to them in expectance of anything in return.

Name: The Mansions of the Stars
Verse: By the heaven, holding mansions of the stars,
Tafseer: By the heaven of the constellations the twelve constellations of the planets — as explained in sūrat al-Furqān Q. 2561;

Name: The Mansions of the Stars
Verse: And by the Promised Day.
Tafseer: and by the promised day the Day of Resurrection;

Name: The Mansions of the Stars
Verse: And by the witness and that whereunto he beareth testimony,
Tafseer: and by the witness Friday and the witnessed the day of ‘Arafa — that is how these three elements have been explained in hadīth for the first one is ‘promised’ the second one is ‘a witness’ that testifies to deeds performed in it while the third is ‘witnessed’ by mankind and angels the introductory particle of the response to the oath has been omitted but is implied to be laqad ‘verily’ sc. laqad qutila ashābu’l-ukhdūd

Name: The Mansions of the Stars
Verse: (Self-)destroyed were the owners of the ditch
Tafseer: perish accursed be the men of the ditch! the pit in the ground

Name: The Mansions of the Stars
Verse: Of the fuel-fed fire,
Tafseer: of the fire al-nāri is an inclusive substitution of it al-ukhdūdi ‘of the ditch’ abounding in fuel by which it was fuelled

Name: The Mansions of the Stars
Verse: When they sat by it,
Tafseer: when they sat by it around the edge of the ditch on chairs

Name: The Mansions of the Stars
Verse: And were themselves the witnesses of what they did to the believers.
Tafseer: and they themselves to what they did to those who believed in God in the way of torturing them by hurling them into the fire when they did not recant their faith were witnesses they were themselves present thereat. It is reported in a hadīth that God saved the believers who had been thrown into the fire by taking their souls before they fell into it and that the fire then rose up and burnt all those sitting around it.

Name: The Mansions of the Stars
Verse: They had naught against them save that they believed in Allah, the Mighty, the Owner of Praise,
Tafseer: And all that they were vindicative towards them of was that they believed in God the Mighty in His kingdom the Praised

Name: The Mansions of the Stars
Verse: Him unto Whom belongeth the Sovereignty of the heavens and the earth; and Allah is of all things the Witness.
Tafseer: to Whom belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth and God is Witness to all things in other words all that the disbelievers disavowed of the believers was their faith.

Name: The Mansions of the Stars
Verse: Lo! they who persecute believing men and believing women and repent not, theirs verily will be the doom of hell, and theirs the doom of burning.
Tafseer: Indeed those who persecute believing men and believing women by having them burnt then do not repent there will be for them the chastisement of Hell in return for their disbelief and there will also be for them the chastisement of burning that is to say the chastisement for their having had the believers burnt in the Hereafter; but it is also said that there is this chastisement for them in this world as when the fire rose up and burnt them as mentioned above.

Name: The Mansions of the Stars
Verse: Lo! those who believe and do good works, theirs will be Gardens underneath which rivers flow. That is the Great Success.
Tafseer: Indeed those who believe and perform righteous deeds for them there will be gardens underneath which rivers flow that is the supreme triumph.

Name: The Mansions of the Stars
Verse: Lo! the punishment of thy Lord is stern.
Tafseer: Assuredly your Lord’s assault against the disbelievers is severe as severe as He will it to be.

Name: The Mansions of the Stars
Verse: Lo! He it is Who produceth, then reproduceth,
Tafseer: Assuredly it is He Who originates creation and restores and is never thwarted in what He wills

Name: The Mansions of the Stars
Verse: And He is the Forgiving, the Loving,
Tafseer: and He is the Forgiving to sinning believers the Loving the One Who shows love to His friends through His acts of generosity

Name: The Mansions of the Stars
Verse: Lord of the Throne of Glory,
Tafseer: Lord of the Throne its Creator and Possessor the Glorious read nominative al-majīdu the One deserving of the perfect attributes of sublimity

Name: The Mansions of the Stars
Verse: Doer of what He will.
Tafseer: Doer of what He desires nothing able to thwart Him.

Name: The Mansions of the Stars
Verse: Hath there come unto thee the story of the hosts
Tafseer: Have you O Muhammad (s) received the story of the hosts

Name: The Mansions of the Stars
Verse: Of Pharaoh and (the tribe of) Thamud ?
Tafseer: Pharaoh and Thamūd? Fir‘awna wa-Thamūda substitutes for al-junūdi — the mention of ‘Pharaoh’ suffices to also include his followers; their ‘story’ is that they were destroyed for their disbelief and this is meant as a warning for those who deny the Prophet s and the Qur’ān that they may be admonished thereby.

Name: The Mansions of the Stars
Verse: Nay, but those who disbelieve live in denial
Tafseer: Nay but the disbelievers are engrossed in denial of the mentioned;

Name: The Mansions of the Stars
Verse: And Allah, all unseen, surroundeth them.
Tafseer: and God is behind them All-Encompassing — they have no protector against Him.

Name: The Mansions of the Stars
Verse: Nay, but it is a glorious Qur’an.
Tafseer: Nay but it is a glorious a magnificent Qur’ān

Name: The Mansions of the Stars
Verse: On a guarded tablet.
Tafseer: in a tablet suspended above the seventh heaven preserved read mahfūzin from all devils and from having any of its contents altered; it is a high as the distance between the earth and the heaven and as wide as the distance between the east and the west made of white pearls — as stated by Ibn ‘Abbās may God be pleased with both him and his father ‘Abbās

Name: The Morning Star
Verse: By the heaven and the Morning Star
Tafseer: By the heaven and the night-visitor! al-tāriq actually denotes any thing that comes by night including stars because they come out at night.

Name: The Morning Star
Verse: - Ah, what will tell thee what the Morning Star is!
Tafseer: And what will tell you what the night-visitor is? mā’l-tāriq is a subject and predicate standing as the second object of the verb adrā ‘tell’; and what comes after the first mā ‘what’ is the predicate thereof of this first mā — this statement emphasises the magnificence of the ‘night-visitor’ which is explained in what follows. It is

Name: The Morning Star
Verse: - The piercing Star!
Tafseer: The piercing the brilliant because of its piercing the darkness with its light star! meaning the constellation Pleiades; or it refers to all stars the response to the oath follows

Name: The Morning Star
Verse: No human soul but hath a guardian over it.
Tafseer: Over every soul there is a keeper if read la-mā then mā is extra and in is softened in place of the hardened form with its subject omitted that is to say innahu; the lām is a particle for separation; if read lammā then in is for negation and lammā means illā ‘except that’ — the watcher is an angel that keeps a record of its deeds both the good and the evil.

Name: The Morning Star
Verse: So let man consider from what he is created.
Tafseer: So let man consider by way of reflection from what he was created from what thing

Name: The Morning Star
Verse: He is created from a gushing fluid
Tafseer: the response is He was created from a gushing fluid gushing forth from the man and the woman into the womb

Name: The Morning Star
Verse: That issued from between the loins and ribs.
Tafseer: issuing from between the loins of the man and the breast-bones of the woman.

Name: The Morning Star
Verse: Lo! He verily is Able to return him (unto life)
Tafseer: Assuredly He exalted be He is able to bring him back to resurrect man after his death; and so when he reflects on his origins he will realise that the One who was able to do this is also able to resurrect him

Name: The Morning Star
Verse: On the day when hidden thoughts shall be searched out.
Tafseer: on the day when all secrets the hidden convictions and intentions of the hearts are inspected when they are examined and revealed

Name: The Morning Star
Verse: Then will he have no might nor any helper.
Tafseer: whereat he the one who denies resurrection will have neither strength to defend himself against chastisement nor any helper to avert it from him.

Name: The Morning Star
Verse: By the heaven which giveth the returning rain,
Tafseer: By the heaven of returns of the rain that returns time and again

Name: The Morning Star
Verse: And the earth which splitteth (with the growth of trees and plants)
Tafseer: and by the earth of fissures splitting with the growth of vegetation

Name: The Morning Star
Verse: Lo! this (Qur’an) is a conclusive word,
Tafseer: assuredly it the Qur’ān is a decisive word distinguishing between truth and falsehood

Name: The Morning Star
Verse: It is no pleasantry.
Tafseer: and it is not a jest frivolity or falsehood.

Name: The Morning Star
Verse: Lo! they plot a plot (against thee, O Muhammad)
Tafseer: Indeed they that is the disbelievers are devising a plot they are preparing plots against the Prophet s

Name: The Morning Star
Verse: And I plot a plot (against them).
Tafseer: and I too am devising a plot drawing them by degrees towards destruction from whence they know not.

Name: The Morning Star
Verse: So give a respite to the disbelievers. Deal thou gently with them for a while.
Tafseer: So respite O Muhammad (s) the disbelievers; grant them respite reiterated as an emphasis one enhanced by the use of a different form mahhil amhil that is to say put them off for a little ruwaydā is a verbal noun emphasising the import of the operator and is the diminutive form of rūd or irwad with shortening of final consonant ruwaydan ruwaydā. Surely enough God exalted be He seized them at Badr and abrogated the dispensation of ‘granting respite’ by the ‘sword’ verse in other words by the command to fight and struggle.

Name: The Most High
Verse: Praise the name of thy Lord the Most High,
Tafseer: Glorify the Name of your Lord that is exalt your Lord above what does not befit Him ism in isma rabbika ‘the Name of your Lord’ is extra the Most High an adjective qualifying rabbika ‘your Lord’

Name: The Most High
Verse: Who createth, then disposeth;
Tafseer: Who created and proportioned His creature making it of well-proportioned parts without irregularities

Name: The Most High
Verse: Who measureth, then guideth;
Tafseer: and Who determined what He wants and guided to what He had determined of good or evil

Name: The Most High
Verse: Who bringeth forth the pasturage,
Tafseer: and Who brought forth the pasture Who caused herbage to grow

Name: The Most High
Verse: Then turneth it to russet stubble.
Tafseer: then made it after verdancy blackened stubble desiccated broken chaff.

Name: The Most High
Verse: We shall make thee read (O Muhammad) so that thou shalt not forget
Tafseer: We will have you recite the Qur’ān so that you will not forget what you recite

Name: The Most High
Verse: Save that which Allah willeth. Lo! He knoweth the disclosed and that which still is hidden;
Tafseer: except what God may will that you forget by abrogating its recitation and its ruling — the Prophet s used to recite aloud while Gabriel recited fearing to forget and so it is as though it was said to him ‘Do not hasten in it; you will not forget and so do not weary yourself by reciting it aloud’; assuredly He exalted be He knows what is overt of words and deeds and what is hidden of both of these.

Name: The Most High
Verse: And We shall ease thy way unto the state of ease.
Tafseer: And We will ease your way to the easy way the uncomplicated Law namely Islam.

Name: The Most High
Verse: Therefor remind (men), for of use is the reminder.
Tafseer: So remind admonish by the Qur’ān in case the reminder should be of benefit to the one whom you might remind the one mentioned in the following verse ‘he who fears will be reminded’ in other words even if it might not be of benefit for it is of benefit to some but of no benefit to others.

Name: The Most High
Verse: He will heed who feareth,
Tafseer: He who fears God exalted be He will be reminded by it as in the verse So admonish by the Qur’ān him who fears My threat Q. 5045;

Name: The Most High
Verse: But the most hapless will flout it,
Tafseer: but the wretched one al-ashqā means al-shaqī that is to say the disbeliever will shun it that is the reminder in other words he will leave it aside not looking at it

Name: The Most High
Verse: He who will be flung to the great Fire
Tafseer: he who will be roasted in the greater Fire the Fire of the Hereafter the lesser fire being that of this world;

Name: The Most High
Verse: Wherein he will neither die nor live.
Tafseer: then he will neither die therein and find rest nor live a enjoyable life.

Name: The Most High
Verse: He is successful who groweth,
Tafseer: Successful winner indeed is he who purifies himself who cleanses himself by means of his adherence to faith

Name: The Most High
Verse: And remembereth the name of his Lord, so prayeth,
Tafseer: and mentions the Name of his Lord saying Allāhu akbar ‘God is Great’ and prays the five prayers — and such are the concerns of one working towards the Hereafter concerns which the Meccan disbelievers shun.

Name: The Most High
Verse: But ye prefer the life of the world
Tafseer: Nay but you prefer or read yu’thirūna ‘they prefer’ the life of this world to the Hereafter

Name: The Most High
Verse: Although the Hereafter is better and more lasting.
Tafseer: whereas the Hereafter and the Paradise it entails is better and more lasting.

Name: The Most High
Verse: Lo! This is in the former scrolls.
Tafseer: Truly this the success of those who purify themselves and the Hereafter being better is in the former scrolls the ones revealed before the Qur’ān

Name: The Most High
Verse: The Books of Abraham and Moses.
Tafseer: the scrolls of Abraham and Moses the ten scrolls of Abraham and the Torah of Moses.

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: Hath there come unto thee tidings of the Overwhelming ?
Tafseer: Has there — there has indeed — come to you the tiding of the Enveloper? the Resurrection so called because it ‘envelops’ creatures with its terrors.

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: On that day (many) faces will be downcast,
Tafseer: Some faces on that day — they faces are used to represent the individuals in both instances — will be humbled abject

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: Toiling, weary,
Tafseer: toiling weary tired and exhausted from the chains and fetters

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: Scorched by burning fire,
Tafseer: roasting read taslā or tuslā in a scorching fire

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: Drinking from a boiling spring,
Tafseer: made to drink from a boiling spring one of extremely hot temperatures.

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: No food for them save bitter thorn-fruit
Tafseer: They will have no food except cactus darī‘ — a type of thorn plant which no animal grazes on because of its vileness —

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: Which doth not nourish nor release from hunger.
Tafseer: neither nourishing nor availing against hunger.

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: In that day other faces will be calm,
Tafseer: Other faces on that day will be delicate fair

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: Glad for their effort past,
Tafseer: pleased by their efforts in the life of the world expended in obedience pleased in the Hereafter upon seeing the reward thereof;

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: In a high Garden
Tafseer: in a lofty Garden lofty in a physical as well as an abstract sense

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: Where they hear no idle speech,
Tafseer: in which they will not hear read lā yusma‘u ‘will not be heard’ or lā tasma‘u ‘they will not hear’ any vanity any inane soul speaking drivel;

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: Wherein is a gushing spring,
Tafseer: therein is a running spring of water meaning ‘springs’;

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: Wherein are couches raised
Tafseer: therein are lofty couches lofty in terms of their essence their size and physical location

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: And goblets set at hand
Tafseer: and goblets vessels without handles set around the edges of the springs prepared for them to drink with

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: And cushions ranged
Tafseer: and cushions arrayed one next to the other against which they may lean

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: And silken carpets spread.
Tafseer: and carpets rugs of velvet-hair spread out.

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: Will they not regard the camels, how they are created ?
Tafseer: Will they the Meccan disbelievers not consider by way of reflection the camels how they are created?

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: And the heaven, how it is raised ?
Tafseer: And the heaven how it was raised?

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: And the hills, how they are set up ?
Tafseer: And the mountains how they were set?

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: And the earth, how it is spread ?
Tafseer: And the earth how it was laid out flat? and thus infer from this the power of God exalted be He and His Oneness? The commencing with the mention of camels is because they are closer in contact with it the earth than any other animal. As for His words sutihat ‘laid out flat’ this on a literal reading suggests that the earth is flat which is the opinion of most of the scholars of the revealed Law and not a sphere as astronomers ahl al-hay’a have it even if this latter does not contradict any of the pillars of the Law.

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: Remind them, for thou art but a remembrancer,
Tafseer: So remind them of God’s graces and the proofs affirming His Oneness. For you are only an admonisher;

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: Thou art not at all a warder over them.
Tafseer: you are not a taskmaster over them a variant reading for musaytir has musaytir that is to say not one who has been given authority over them — this was revealed before the command to struggle against the disbelievers.

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: But whoso is averse and disbelieveth,
Tafseer: But he who turns away he who rejects faith and disbelieves in the Qur’ān

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: Allah will punish him with direst punishment.
Tafseer: God will chastise him with the greater chastisement the chastisement of the Hereafter the lesser chastisement being that of this world that of being killed or taken captive.

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: Lo! unto Us is their return
Tafseer: Truly to Us will be their return their coming back after death

Name: The Overwhelming
Verse: And Ours their reckoning.
Tafseer: then truly with Us will lie their reckoning their requital which We will never abandon.

Name: The Dawn
Verse: By the Dawn
Tafseer: By the dawn that is to say by the dawn of each day

Name: The Dawn
Verse: And ten nights,
Tafseer: and by the ten nights the first ten nights of Dhū’l-Hijja

Name: The Dawn
Verse: And the Even and the Odd,
Tafseer: and by the even the pair and the odd read watr or witr two alternative forms the single

Name: The Dawn
Verse: And the night when it departeth,
Tafseer: and by the night in motion falling or receding

Name: The Dawn
Verse: There surely is an oath for thinking man.
Tafseer: Is there in that oath an oath for one of sense? one of intellect the response to the oath has been omitted that is to say it is to be understood as something like la-tu‘adhdhabunna yā kuffāra Makka ‘you will assuredly be chastised O disbelievers of Mecca!’.

Name: The Dawn
Verse: Dost thou not consider how thy Lord dealt with (the tribe of) A’ad,
Tafseer: Have you not seen do you not know O Muhammad (s) how your Lord dealt with ‘Ād

Name: The Dawn
Verse: With many-columned Iram,
Tafseer: Iram — these were the former people of ‘Ād Irama is an explicative supplement or a substitution and it is treated as a diptote because it is a proper noun and feminine — of the towering ones that is to say the tall ones — the tallest one among them would reach four hundred cubits —

Name: The Dawn
Verse: The like of which was not created in the lands;
Tafseer: the like of which was not created in the land in terms of their power of assault and strength

Name: The Dawn
Verse: And with (the tribe of) Thamud, who clove the rocks in the valley;
Tafseer: and Thamūd who hollowed hewed the rocks sakhr is the plural of sakhra in the valley the Wādī al-Qurā rocks which they used as dwellings

Name: The Dawn
Verse: And with Pharaoh, firm of might,
Tafseer: and Pharaoh the one of the tent-pegs he used to fasten four pegs and tie to these the hands and feet of those whom he tortured —

Name: The Dawn
Verse: Who (all) were rebellious (to Allah) in these lands,
Tafseer: those who were rebellious became tyrannical in the land

Name: The Dawn
Verse: And multiplied iniquity therein ?
Tafseer: and caused much corruption therein? by way of slaying and otherwise.

Name: The Dawn
Verse: Therefore thy Lord poured on them the disaster of His punishment.
Tafseer: So your Lord poured on them a scourge of chastisement.

Name: The Dawn
Verse: Lo! thy Lord is ever watchful.
Tafseer: Assuredly your Lord is ever on the watch watching over the deeds of servants nothing of which escapes Him that He may then requite them for these deeds.

Name: The Dawn
Verse: As for man, whenever his Lord trieth him by honouring him, and is gracious unto him, he saith: My Lord honoureth me.
Tafseer: And as for man the disbeliever whenever his Lord tests him and honours him with wealth and other things and is gracious to him he says ‘My Lord has honoured me’.

Name: The Dawn
Verse: But whenever He trieth him by straitening his means of life, he saith: My Lord despiseth me.
Tafseer: But when he tests him and restricts his provision for him he says ‘My Lord has humiliated me’.

Name: The Dawn
Verse: Nay, but ye (for your part) honour not the orphan
Tafseer: No indeed! — a disavowal of this notion in other words honour is not about wealth nor is there any humiliation in poverty rather it has to do with obedience and disobedience respectively; but the disbelievers of Mecca unmindful of this.
